Reviews.Title: “Very conveneint for shopping”
Reviews.Author: trucker64
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at The Orlando. Staff was very accommodating, allowing us to check in early and check out late. Valet was quick. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Rooms were clean with very nice bathrooms and fluffy towels. Good central and safe location. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This boutique hotel works for the young and hip as well as us more senior guests”
Reviews.Author: RockyMountaintravel
Reviews.Content: While we travel to LA frequently to see family, this was our first stay in the Beverly Hills/West Hollywood area. On our daughter's recommendation, we stayed at the Orlando and couldn't have been more pleased. We were initially concerned that the hotel might be too hip for us older travelers, but we felt perfectly at ease here and noticed we weren't the only 50+ year old travelers staying (though this fact shouldn't scare away the younger crowd who clearly outnumbered us). Here's what we really liked: First, the service from the front desk to the valet was outstanding and always pleasant and friendly (special kudos to Paul). (We do think the cost of parking per day - $29 - is pretty steep even for LA.) Customer service is one of our main criterion in rating a property and The Orlando did not disappoint! Second, the room was quiet, roomy, and comfortable. As requested, we were given an upper floor room away from the elevator. Having a peaceful room to escape to is another of our criteria and again, The Orlando came through! Despite having a connecting room, we never heard our next door neighbors. We appreciated that the linens are high quality, the flat screen TV is huge, there's an in room coffee maker, nice robes/slippers are provided, and the newspaper is delivered to your door. The bathroom, which is newly remodeled, is modern and sleek and has a great shower. My husband wished the mattress was a little firmer and the down comforter not so warm, but I found the bedding just fine. Third, as others have reported, the location is excellent. If you want to be in a touristy location, then the Orlando is not for you. However, if you want to feel like you live in this part of LA, then stay here. Third Street is a happening place, but not in a crazy way. Cute, interesting shops and trendy restaurants frequented by locals. While the in hotel restaurant, The Churchill, is very popular right now, the noise from there seems to be pretty confined. We enjoyed two breakfasts at Joan's on 3rd, as well as desserts from Magnolia Bakery which is across the street. In summary, The Orlando will be our new go-to property when staying in the Beverly Hills/West Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jene74
Reviews.Content: This is a great little Boutique hotel with great service and some added touches that you just don't get at other hotels. Upon arrival, we found a welcome cupcake in our room from the bakery across the street. Chocolates on the pillow each night. The staff truly went above and beyond to make sure that we had everything we needed during our stay. The first night we parked our car with the valet because we got in late, but there is plenty of on-street parking in the vicinity. On the second day of our stay, we parked on the street by the hotel but left the lights on in our rental car. Someone on the valet staff actually remembered our car and the hotel left us a telephone message to let us know that the lights were on. This would not happen at a larger hotel chain and it is one example of what makes this place unique. The bed was EXTREMELY comfortable too.

Reviews.Title: “good location in Beverly Hills & West Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: riverwest
Reviews.Content: Valet & check in was quick, plenty of places to walk to(food & shopping). valet included in & out privilages. nice hall carpeting that matched curtains in the room. pool was very small as well as the gym, nice that gym is open 24 hours and had water, towels and a bathroom + shower, they have wifi also noticed they do have computers to use.

Reviews.Title: “See the real LA With A Neighborhood Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: barry10028
Reviews.Content: Once again, The Frugal Guy breaks with standard practice, pays full price and gets what he bargained for. The wife wanted a So-Cal vacation and as I lived there at one time, I decided we would spend the LA portion of our trip in my old neighborhood, rather than get taken by the more touristy locations. Good choice. The Orlando is right on Third Street, which connects you to LA - West Hollywood and Beverly Hills, in an instant. The staff was genuinely nice and helpful, the rooms were very clean and comfortable and the rate, which I shopped for was reasonable, once you give into paying full price. ( I did shop, found a slightly lower rate through a booking site and took advantage of their "Best Rate Guarantee" which delivered the lower rate and an upgrade, although I have my doubts about what room we ultimately wound up in. They told us it was a Deluxe King, but we passed another room being cleaned and it had a much bigger bathroom, which I was told is the difference between the Standard and Deluxe.) Either way, the room, while being perhaps slightly dated, was great. The King Size bed was great. The turn-down service left little chocolates for us and we were in the back, facing the pool which did not cause any problems. VALET PARKING is not cheap at $29 a day, however in that area, the rules on the streets are dependent on neighborhood parking permits. There are meters you can probably use on Third Street, if you time it right after 6pm at night and before 8am in the mornings. If you are staying in LA and do not want to get caught up in the touristy traps, The Orlando Hotel is the safe, sane and solid way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Love it in every way”
Reviews.Author: poosu
Reviews.Content: The staffs are super duper wonderful, the service is excellent. The room is renovated and is kept very clean. The bed has real comforter and offers really good linen that are soft. The location location location could not be better. I'm coming back to LA soon and will be staying here again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimriz
Reviews.Content: This place has the best service I've ever encountered in a hotel. Newly renovated rooms are comfortable, quiet, and have everything you need. Great location, safe, and luxurious... All for a great price. There is no better deal to be had in Los Angeles. And if you aren't comfortable in your room as I read from another reviewer, ask for a change. The staff want you to be comfortable here. Not sure why you wouldn't make a call to see what else could be available.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Aly A
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate on a website and decided to stay here for the night because I had a big project for work due and needed some peace and quiet away from the family. The first room I was sent to did not even have a room number on the door. I cautiously inserted my key and discovered that it was indeed the correct room. However, within 10 minutes, I had to call the front desk and request a room change because the sound of the air conditioner units on the roof were literally SHAKING the windows. They moved me to a room down the hall which was unfortunately a connecting room. I did not want to be THAT person so I just dealt with all of the noise coming from the connecting room. I settled in to do work and watch a movie. But the entire movie system was down. So much for that idea. I tried to order Room Service and was placed on hold for over 5 minutes. I had to call the front desk and have them place the order. The food was very good but there was no tray left so I had to place the plates outside my door. Not exactly sanitary. Then I wanted to order some cookies for a late night snack. I called down to room service (which is the hotel restaurant) and was greeted by perhaps the rudest room service person ever. She told me it was loud and I had to speak up. And when she still couldn't hear me she copped such a b*%chy attitude and proceeded to either disconnect me or put me on hold. At that point, I hung up and called the front desk. They were very helpful and placed the order for me. The room is okay for the price. Do not get an adjoining room. Much too noisy. And the Room Service is horrible. They charged me an 18 percent service charge but never told me - nor was it indicated on the receipt. So I ended up double tipping. And not having the movie service definitely was a negative. The front desk staff was very helpful. But they could not erase the awful customer service provided by the Room Service staff. I often stay at the Palomar on the Westside which is another boutique hotel. Similarly priced but SO much better in terms of service and amenities. Needless to say, I won't be returning to the Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AletheaTravels
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review for another LA hotel called Sky Boutique Hotel which I felt was poor value and mentioned in that review that I found another hotel with better value in LA that really was a boutique hotel and not just trying to cash in on the boutique trend. This is the hotel. I found the staff to be very professional and accommodation, the rooms were newly renovated, the location good, and compared to the other hotels I checked out in LA, of good value.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Tuckepoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for two night last month and had a wonderful stay. The area - west 3rd is a very hip area with lots of great breakfast spots and funky boutiques. It's also close to the Beverly center and Beverly connection as well as a short walk to the farmers market and the grove. Churchills resto and abr is a late night hot spot within the hotel again. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne A
Reviews.Content: My girl friends and I drove up to Hollywood last min on a Saturday night without a hotel reservation. We found this hotel on-line while driving around. The staff at the Orlando greeted us in a friendly fashion and offered us a great rate. The rooms were clean and chic; had everything we needed! (including an iPod connection and a full length mirror- (score) lol!) Great location and great staff! I will stay here again next time I come back -100%!

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Alexander B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Orlando hotel for 2 nights and found it very pleasant and nice place to stay in LA. Location is very good as it is pretty close to many local attractions, shopping malls and restaurant. We can recommend to visit Farmers market and Grove located next to the market. Hotel itself is well renovated, comfortable beds, big rooms and TVs, excellent bathroom with walk-in shower. No comments on hotel restaurant and pool as we did not try them. We very much liked the front desk service and pricing was good. Therefore, we can recommend this hotel as very good 'value for money' proposition in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Mels13148
Reviews.Content: Where do I start to describe The Orlando - 'one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at', and that's just the beginning!!!! From the moment I walked in the door, the staff were amazing. They are all professional, friendly, kind and will all go out of their way to provide whatever you need. I have to take a moment to mention Guest Services Manager, Paul Gardner. I have stayed in many hotels over the years, but I have never met someone who was so wonderful, treated everyone with kindness and respect, and would do literally anything to make your stay an great experience. Maybe more impressive than that is that every one of his staff members respected him, and talked kindly about him as soon as you mentioned his name - a very very rare quality. Also, I must mention Managing Director Tohnia Miller. She was also extremely kind, and caring, and has done an incredible upgrade job on the hotel. The room was extremely comfortable, and very spacious. The bathroom was beautiful, and had everything you needed, where you needed it - including a great hairdryer! There was a lovely pool, and fitness room too. I was sick the first night I arrived there, and even though I wanted something off menu from the room service menu the staff were more than happy to help out. Thank you again to all at The Orlando - you made my stay! I look forward to returning again soon.

Reviews.Title: “You're missing out if you don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: DentistDorisUSN
Reviews.Content: Lovely location! Proximity to restaurants and boutiques was convenient so that I was able to walk to get breakfast and do some shopping. I loved how CLEAN and chic it was. Modern tiles and furniture. Frosted glass sliding door into the bathroom. Great amenities in terms of providing cotton rounds, cotton swabs, Terry cloth hair elastic, etc. The sink had an usual stopper so when I called the front desk, they sent someone immediately to fix it. Sauna was closed down permanently during the hotel's reconstruction, so the heated outdoor salt water pool was my only option but a good option. roof top pool in the sense that nothing was overhead but the sky. I was right next to the elevator on the second floor where you could hear the immensely loud club below but when I walked into my room, it was sound proof and I forgot all about it. The bar downstairs is free to guests and a vibrant place for young, social people. Has a cute fireplace and you can choose an indoor or outdoor scene to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at a trendy location.”
Reviews.Author: SJunie
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that we have ever chosen to stay at a boutique hotel instead of one of the big chain hotels, and it was a great decision! The front desk service is friendly and helpful. They always greet you when you arrive or leave and take the time to answer any question that was asked. Since we had booked on one of the "name to be revealed after you pay" sites, we weren't expecting The Orlando to accommodate our request of two beds instead of a king bed. They didn't have a double room when we checked in, but gave us a spacious room with a king and a pull out sofabed. They also honored my request of getting a room on one of the higher floors and away from the elevators. The fact that I booked on a discount site was never mentioned. Very discreet and professional! Since the hotel had just finished a major renovation and update, the room was clean and very nicely appointed with modern amenities. The bed was super comfortable, and they offer a turn down service at night complete with chocolates on your pillows. The bathroom was on the smaller side, but again, very nicely appointed. There is no bathtub in the hotel's bathrooms, but it wasn't an issue for us as we prefer to shower anyways. For the three nights that we were there, we slept comfortably, and had a very pleasant, quiet stay. The only minor negative is that the hotel has only one public computer and printer in the lounge, so sometimes, it is quite inconvenient waiting for someone to finish on the computer so that you can use the printer. The hotel itself is situated right on trendy 3rd Street with many restaurants and boutiques. They have their in house restaurant that just opened which we never got around to eating at, but every time that we passed by, it was packed. I highly recommend Joan's On Third (http://joansonthird.com/), which is right down the street from The Orlando, for at least one brunch or lunch. Their sandwiches and desserts are fabulous. For cheap and filling eats, there is a Soup Plantation ten minutes away in the direction of the Beverly Center. In the same complex as the Soup Plantation, there is also a CVS drugstore for any last minute purchases. The Grove and the Farmer's Market is a 15 minute walk away. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel as well as more bus routes all within a 10 minute walk away if you are depending on public transportation. I highly recommend The Orlando for anyone that is looking for a non big chain hotel experience coupled with fantastic customer service and overall great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: tuxedobob
Reviews.Content: I typically stay at a big box brand where I have a high loyalty ranking. However being in LA I wanted to stay in a smaller boutique hotel in a cool area. My friend recommended the Orlando. It was great, the room was really spacious and the bed was very comfortable. However, that's the easy part to me because you can buy that. However, what I was really impressed with was the phenomenal service that I received. Jeff at the front desk made me feel very welcome, he made restaurant recommendations and called a couple to check availability. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great hotel at a reasonable cost in a cool neighbourhood. Locally, I really enjoyed Sushi Roki & Little Next Door for dinner and magnolia bakery & toast for breakfast/ brunch

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DumnATanker
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel. Normally I don't stay at boutique hotels, but one of my sales reps reccommended it to me. It is a great place to stay, relax, work, and just veg out. The rooms are awesome. Last time I stayed the restaurant wasn't reopened. I can't wait for my next stay. There are great places to eat all around. Plus the cupcake on my bed when I check in is awesome. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “The Orlando, Los Angeles, revisited after a major renovation”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen7375
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at The Orlando Hotel multiple times over the last few years during visits to our son who moved to Los Angeles in 2009. So you could say that The Orlando is our â€œgo toâ€� hotel in LA. The hotel is a very good value, being centrally located, within easy reach of great shopping (Beverly Center and The Grove, Sunset Boulevard and the theater district. West 3rd street has some really interesting boutiques and a wide variety of restaurants serving breakfast, lunch and dinner, and providing a range of prices. The Churchill restaurant attached to the hotel has been completely renovated and serves light, tasty meals throughout the day, as well as providing room service for guests at The Orlando. It is also a very popular place on week-end evenings with the younger crowd. The only downside to this is that it can be quite noisy outside the hotel on week-ends as people wait to get in, but we did not get disturbed in our bedroom During the time we have been staying at The Orlando, the hotel has undergone an extensive renovation, making it an ever more attractive option. So this is an update on a previous review that we did for this hotel in 2010. The rooms have fully refurbished bathrooms, and the dÃ©cor is attractive and restful. Theyâ€™ve even added the option of several suites, which are very nicely appointed and reasonably priced for the area. The beds are very comfortable, among the best we have experienced in our stays at many excellent hotels around the world. The wi-fi is free and the new large screen TV a bonus. But, a hotel is not judged just by its amenities â€“ the staff is a very important part of the experience. We have found all of the Orlando employees to be courteous and extremely helpful, often going the extra mile to meet a clientâ€™s needs. The fact that the hotel is family owned is really evident in the interactions that we have had with all the guest services staff, the housekeeping staff and the valet team of Estaban. You really get the feeling that everyone cares that you have a positive, problem-free experience. Thanks Orlando! Looking forward to seeing you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “American Girl Doll Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MissMagpieVT
Reviews.Content: Not living in a state where there is an American Girl Doll Store, I decided to treat my daughter to a really special birthday gift this year. We headed to West Hollywood to stay at the Orlando hotel which offers the perfect Mother-Daughter getaway with their â€œAmerican Girl Doll Packageâ€�. You will find this Los Angeles boutique hotel perfectly situated in the trendy West 3rd shopping district â€“flanked on one side by the Beverly Center and on the other by The Grove. We stayed on the 5th floor in a Standard King with a city view. We had a large King-sized bed plus a miniature American Girl doll sized bed! The furnishings are very modern and included an armoire, open shelving that ran the half the length of the room, a small couch, and a nice sized desk. I also appreciated high-tech touches in the room including free Wi-Fi. Additionally, there was a great bedside clock with an iPad charger, a separate Bose iPod docking station and a very large flat screen TV. Also worth noting, in the lobby, guests have free use of a Mac with a printer that I used to grab my boarding passes before heading home. You will find a small, under utilized, salt-water pool on the 2nd floor. It is only 4 feet deep. A small bench ran the length of the pool (approx. 1 foot deep). This could be good for younger children who might not be able to stand, as there was not a traditional shallow end. There are several lounge chairs and two very nice seating areas. On the morning we went swimming, we had the whole pool to ourselves. The hotel has recently undergone multi-million dollar renovations. They enlarged the bathrooms, created two bedroom suites, and refurbished much of the hotelâ€™s dÃ©cor. Included in this major renovation project is an all-new gastropub, The Churchill. While there are cribs available (no extra charge) this hotel might not be the best choice for families with small children. There are not many amenities that cater towards younger kids under 5. You only will find a childrenâ€™s menu when ordering from room service and there are showers only, not a tub, in standard rooms. Plus the outlying area of the hotel doesnâ€™t scream toddler friendly. The beach and Disneyland is nowhere in sight. I would suggest staying here though here if you are planning the perfect weekend getaway with your little fashionista. There isnâ€™t a better spot that puts you smack in the middle of specialty shops, high-end fashion malls, fine dinning with the perfect place to relax at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Taylor W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orlando for one night while in LA for work and it was definitely a great stay for a great price. The room was modern with a comfy bed and wonderful amenities that I look for when traveling, especially for work. The room was large, I was greeted with a personalized note and a Magnolia cupcake, the bathroom was modern, the robe was fluffy, all the things one would expect from a hotel in this area. The restaurant and bar attached to the hotel were very fun with amazing drinks served in mason jars. Room service was good and runs 24-hours. The plasma TV was what one has come to expect when traveling in a major city. There were just a few little things that keep me from making this a five star rating (like they were asking their guests to rate them on this site so they could bump up a level): - The coffee maker in my room did not work - There were zero easily accessible plugs in my room - I had to crawl under my bed to plug in my laptop and crawl under the desk to reach behind the mini-fridge to plug in the coffee maker that ended up not working - There were a handful of random short black curly hairs on my bathroom floor that I did not notice until the following morning that were humanly impossible of coming from me - There was no self parking - my boss picked me up and dropped me off and she had to wait in the very small entry driveway for me both times. The bathroom cleanliness issue was my number one issue with this place, but if the cleaning crew could just be a little more thorough, I wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Local get's "away"”
Reviews.Author: Julia M
Reviews.Content: I live in LA and whenever I need to "get away" and relax for a night, I stay at Orlando Hotel. The price is perfect, the staff is refreshingly polite. Paul, the front desk manager is an exceptional gem here. He was helpful and not too rigid, a most sincere person. The rooms were clean and included every imaginable comfort. Next time I will have to try the new restaurant "Churchill" downstairs. It seemed pretty happening. Also, views are very nice. Oh, they are pet friendly! Which is the most important thing for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: canuckgal33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights for a girls weekend in November. The hotel is in a great location. It was about $50 for a cab from the airport to the hotel. There are cabs always readily available at the hotel, and if there aren't they will call one very quickly for you. There are some great restaurants on the main street (Joan's on Third) and a convenience store right across the street. It's a quick walk to the Grove/Famer's Market and CBS Studios, the Beverly Center and Hollywood was a quick and cheap cab ride. Check in was very quick and the front desk staff were always very polite and helpful. The room was wonderful. Very clean and modern. The beds were very comfortable with lots of pillows and clean/fresh linens. The carpet was in good condition...no worries about walking around barefoot on a nasty carpet...this was very clean. Nice flat screen tv with lots of table top space (desk, bedside table and mantel) to put things. Air conditioning is controlled by a thermostat on the wall and the temperature was always very comfortable. Didn't hear any noise from the street, in the hallways or from adjoining rooms. The bathroom was great. Very clean and well stocked. HUGE shower and loads of counter space. Lots of little cubbies to store things too! Free wifi and a free computer in the lobby...with a printer to print boarding passes! LOVE that! It's a great hotel, very reasonably priced. I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Orlando is a great locale”
Reviews.Author: BaronessEast
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Kimpton, but had to choose a hotel next to my meeting site. I was pleasantly surprised by Hotel Orlando. It has a 'brand new' feel to it and the rooms were spacious with great bathrooms. The hotel is located right by a street full of organic delis and cute boutique shops. There is Magnolias Bakery right across the street and only 2 blocks away from Beverly Center Shopping and Yogurtland. We stayed there for an entire week and ate at a different place every day within walking distance. The Churchill, the restaurant inside the hotel, is great and they have tables reserved for guests so you never have to wait during a busy Friday or Saturday night. I was very pleased with the service too, everyone was super nice. I will def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A VERY SPECIAL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jamez4
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at The Orlando for 12 nights after flying non stop from Sydney Australia to Los Angeles. The hotel and all the staff we encounted were wonderful from the moment we arrived until our departure. The front desk crew are really special. The room was freshly renovated with plenty of space, a big screen television, fabulous beds, free wifi and a new bathroom.Everything worked as it should and as a bonus the hotel location is excellent. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RosemaryYonkers
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick trip to LA. We stayed two nights at the Orlando. What a wonderful hotel! Extremely friendly and helpful people at the front desk. Lovely room-just the right size! The bed was so comfortable and we slept really well. The bathroom is modern and the shower felt awesome. Also very quiet. No air-conditioner noise which is way too common in most hotels. Fully stocked refrigerator if you choose to use it, too. That amenity is gone from most hotels. The location is excellent. You can walk to many very good restaurants, the Beverly Center, the Grove and the Farmer's Market. In 10- 15 minutes you can be at the corner of Hollywood and Vine. We would most definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: LJBS
Reviews.Content: Traveled to LA for business near Cedar Sinai. Perfect location, nicely appointed and great service. Great value and will definitely stay again. I wish they would have a low rate guarantee because I saw a lower published rate on Expedia but wasn't able to find the same price on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Hotel, LA's "in-the-know" secret boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bianca1000
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here and my parents have stayed here. It is in a great location. It is a chic, understated boutique hotel. It is LA's "in-the-know" secret boutique hotel. Service was excellent. Nicole at the front desk was very friendly. I like the design and the restaurant has 1/2 orders of pasta. It is down the street from Joan's on Third (which is a paparazzi-looking-to-snap-a-celebrity photo), which is one of LA's best cafes. It is also close to Robertson Blvd, Beverly Hills, Beverly Center Shopping Mall and other chic destinations. I wish I could have a permanent room here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPrestons
Reviews.Content: The location of this boutique hotel is the best part of staying there. Located within walking distance of the Beverly Centre, The Grove and the Farmer's Market. 3rd St has so many great restaurants on it that it's hard to choose where to go. Not to mention being so close to Melrose, Santa Monica Blvd, there is so much choice within 10 minutes of the hotel. Before we checked in, a colleague mentioned that the hotel was under construction. Upon checking in there wasn't much construction going on but you could see that renovations were definately being done or in the process of by looking at the walls, carpet, elevator, etc. My first room was on the top floor, the 5th floor. Room was spacious but the bathroom was less than desirable. About the size of a shoe box, with no counter space and a door that was more suited to being a janitor's door. My colleague's room was quite the opposite. Bathroom was super big with sliding doors. So I asked to be moved to another room that had a better bathroom as I could not stand opening and the closing (or should I say, slamming, as that is what the door did) every time i wanted to go to the bathroom. My second room was better although it was still not as big as my colleagues. When the renovations were done on the bathroom, the mess was not cleaned up 100%. Glue on the walls, dry wall dust, etc. was evident and sightly. If a few extra minutes were taken to clean it up when they did the renovations on the room, it would have looked better. However, the finishings were very nice. Great shower, sink, etc. And the king size bed was super comfortable. All considering, since you don't spend alot of time in your hotel room in LA, I would definately stay there again if the $ was right.

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: aatrip08
Reviews.Content: Great location close to shopping, easy walk to The Grove and other great shopping centres. Only stayed a night but would definately consider this hotel again the next time we are in L.A. Service was great. The tapas bar downstairs was fantastic for lunch, though we did find the breakfast overpriced for what we received. Overall, great value for money hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint boutique hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: fybr01
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Orlando Hotel for a 3 day trip to LA. Had a few issues with check in where our room wasn't ready by the time we arrived. We did get there early (noon) and check in was at 3P. So we had lunch and came back around 2P and room still wasn't ready. Then about 15-20 minutes later, we were told our room was ready but when we went up to the room, housekeeping were in the room and it was nowhere near ready. We were finally given a different room that was clean and ready. I know we were early but I wonder if the room would have been ready if we got there after 3p (since they were still cleaning at 2:30p).....Anyway, once we were all settled in, the stay was very nice. The room was clean and the beds were unbelievably comfortable (I slept so well!!). Had some issues with the sink and slow drainage but maintenance came and took care of the problem. The staff in general was friendly and willing to help. The pool was small but serviceable. The gym too had a few pieces of equipment (no treadmill!) but I wasn't planning on working out anyway so it wasn't a huge loss. The hotel is also in a fabulous location...close to Hollywood, Beverly Hills, and Santa Monica as well as being walking distance from The Grove and the Beverly Center. I had a good stay overall and would definitely consider staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the great location, ultra courteous staff & pretty good rates”
Reviews.Author: middleagedfoodie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Everytime we came through the lobby, a staff member never failed to look up from their desk to say hello. When we left, they even offered to print out Google maps to our next destination. The valets were equally courteous and fast too. The room is nice, but not luxurious, but commenserate with the prices. Quality linens and bathrobes were a nice touch. The bathroom was small but very chic and modern. Having a scale in the room was a plus. Fabulous location for us since we are foodies. Great breakfast and dinner choices within blocks, two of the best, right on the same block. The famous LA Farmers's Market, a 10 minute walk. Lots of interesting funky stores in the surrounding blocks. Two blocks to Beverly Center for middlebrow shopping amenities if you forgot something. The pool was quite small as was the fitness room. It was too cool for the pool, so that was not an issue. Since we were walking a lot each day, I didn't have a lot of time to exercise, so this was not a concern, but from other reviews, it sounds like they are planning to make improvements. Anyway, at this price point, I certainly don't expect perfection. Unless we hit the lottery, we'll definitely stay here if we return to SoCal. Maybe, even if we do hit the lottery.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough informartion provided.”
Reviews.Author: jonah57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orlando for 4 nights at the beginning of September,2011, whilst visiting my elder daughter. I had booked the room based on the information provided on the Hotel web site which after recent checks has not been changed. We arrived late, after 11, and tired went straight to bed, not however without noticing the work on going in the hotel, NOT mentioned on their own web site.The following day we had to walk through a building site on our floor to view the pool and the gym.We later realised that neither the bar nor the restaurant were available, as they were both in the process of being rebuilt. Again , NOT mentioned on the Hotel web site. This was not deemed an omission by the duty manager, nor bu the Hotel manager who advised they had closed the restaurant because of so many complaints about the breakfasts. Maybe replacing the chef would have been more cost effective? But from start to finish, no acknowledgement that this information should be provided for potential customers to make an informed view on whether or not to book at the hotel, nor that omitting this information was likely to cause a feeling of resentment for those who had booked. The room was good, no doubts, the staff apart from fatuous comments about no information about the building work, were fine. However if i had known that there was ( and still is) NO bar and NO restaurant, as well as building work on going, I would certainly have booked elsewhere. The offer of a bottle of wine from the duty manager was refused, as the point seemed to have been lost as to why I was having a moan. So when a bottle appeared in our room from another manager, it was returned to reception. I still believe that ALL the staff at the Hotel believe that there was no fault in keeping information that there was no bar, no restaurant and building work on going throughought the Hotel from potential customers. And being constantly told that the Web Site had been updated is manifestly rubbish. And you are correct, we will not stay there again, and i would reccommend any one else to avoid a Hotel that has a problem in telling the truth. Phil Jones.

Reviews.Title: “A great option in LA”
Reviews.Author: JohnByng
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, spacious room with superb bed and linens, nice bath. Exceptionally helpful front desk staff, and a great location for exkploring museums, restaurants, and shops. I look forward to an improved gym and spa when the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “This Is The Place to Stay in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Vivien55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orlando late August 2011 and were just delighted by the service, I have to say we travelled from LA by car to Vancouver and our last hotel on the way home was this wonderful spot and it was in our top 3 hotels of a very long trip. Everything was beautiful,comfy beds,wonderful soaps and creams in the bathroom, everything fresh and clean all day, every day! Our daughter had her personal belongings stolen at a nightclub the night before we left LA on the long trip home to Australia. Sam on the reception bent over backwards to help out with all our needs relating to this problem, he allowed us extra time in our room,he called the club where the loss occured three times and was just superb in what was a difficult situation, nothing was too much trouble. I would highly recommend this hotel and these wonderful people, just the "best"

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great experience with the Orlando for the main site for our wedding guests. Although the hotel was undergoing some renovations, the service was fantastic--particularly from Marcela in Reservations--and the rooms were nice. This is a great option for a fun, relatively inexpensive hotel in the West Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it very much and will return.”
Reviews.Author: Luise L
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms (we stayed July and August 2011) were very clean and the linen fresh. Toiletries were provided and were of a high standard. Mostly for me it was the service at the front desk (namely, Erica) - she was fantastic - nothing was too much trouble. Her service, as well as the other reception staff, was always courteous and friendly. She made our stay so comfortable and stress-free. The idea of "happy hour" was also a wonderful way to meet other staff, as well as guests. I would highly recommend the Orlando Hotel (Los Angeles) to any of my friends travelling to America. I know we will certainly stay at the Orlando when next we visit. Thanks to Erica, and all the reception staff, for making our stay a most memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: Kurt2010
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel was undergoing renovations, our street-facing room was quiet. The room decor was modern and the amenities were welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mkfincher
Reviews.Content: I was booked to stay at another hotel, but due to a water main break, the other place booked a room at the Orlando. Turns out Orlando was a little more nicer and elegant. The room was spacious and very comfortable, and the staff was friendly and very willing to help with any needs. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suchesNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for five nights with my husband and 14 year old. Had a room on the third floor, facing street with a king bed and pull out sofa. Bed was very comfortable, room was well laid out with plenty of drawers and large closet. Bathroom, while small, was very nice- toiletries, hair dryer and bathrobe/slippers provided. We were greeted with a Magnolia cupcake in our room on our arrival- yum! Evening turn down with a little chocolate was nice also. The pool was located on the second floor- you must go through the exercise room to access it. It was small but relaxing and the sun deck had plently of lounge chairs and a outdoor lounge area. Everyone from the front desk to the valet to the manager ( who threw a wine and cheese reception weekday evenings) was extremely friendly and helpful. Currently there are ongoing renovations and construction but this did not detract from a delightful stay. The location is also a big plus- Magnolia right across the street ( maybe too convenient) great restaurants- try Sushi Roku, Amore Pizzeria and Allora Cucina Italiano- and great little shops. Next time in LA will definetely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I'll DEFINITELY be back!”
Reviews.Author: DrFredGoh
Reviews.Content: Great room, comfortable bed, ultra-friendly and efficient staff,very nice room amenities including Wolfgang Puck coffee. Wireless internet works well. Near copy shops if you need to print stuff! Staples round the corner for supply! Good location at crossroads, you can go east-west down 3rd Street or walk a bit and go down La Cienega Blvd to go north to Hollywood or South to Target, Toys R Us and Walmart. I'll DEFINITELY be back! Thanks guys and gals for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bad from the start...”
Reviews.Author: kenhecra
Reviews.Content: The quality of service should match the partnership of Preferred Hotel Group. Never have I felt as uncomfortable to stay at an establishment where management argued with guests. Policies are understandable when presented properly. However, when relaying it is company policy to not allow Early Check in and charging for a rollaway when double accommodations are not available, well that just undercompensates the notion of my stay. The front desk manager was quite dandy. She seemed to welcome every guests, except for me to the hotel. Thank you for providing me with the level of service that I would expect from a 2 star hotel. Remember, it is the quality of the staff that makes the stay. Lead by example. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Fine business stay near Cedars Sinai Medical Center”
Reviews.Author: jt_powell
Reviews.Content: A colleague recommended we stay at the Orlando hotel during a trip to work with a research collaborators at the Cedars Sinai medical center. The Orlando was being renovated during our stay and the restaurant was closed (although room service was available). Construction was evident in the hallways but was not disruptive to our stay. The rooms were nicely appointed - including a very comfortable bed, large flat panel TV and free wireless internet. On returning from our first day we were very pleasantly surprised by a wine and cheese reception served by congenial hosts in the hotel library. The artisan cheese selection was excellent and we enjoyed the wine. I don't know if this is offered when the hotel restaurant is open, but it is was a genuine treat. The medical center, restaurants and shopping are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hotel in this part of LA for the money”
Reviews.Author: BimBam976
Reviews.Content: High quality rooms and quiet. Ask for Curtis; he's awesome at front desk. Kudos for being entirely smoke-free. Valet parking guys are great. Never a wait. You can walk to everything from here. Typical hot LA chicks at the front desk. Super friendly. I will ALWAYS stay here when visiting family, who live off Melrose.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller58
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for shopping, with lots of popular dining /coffee cafes & restuarants just 2 minutes around the corner . We stayed 3 nights during the long w/end of 4th July celebrations 2011. Hotel has been newly renovated with modern stylish decor, staff always very helpfu &, friendly. Free internet use in guest common area lounge. Hotel also has pool, gym and steam room. Rooms are immaculate and beds very comfortable. Hotel Restuarant was closed due to renovations, large choice of cafes & restuarants around the corner to the Hotel made it easy to find somewhere to eat and drink. Opposite corner to the Hotel was the cake shop "Magnolia Cupcakes" which has its other famous shop of the same name in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Nicstar99
Reviews.Content: I was welcomed with a big smile and really friendly/helpful front desk staff. After a long trip this is always nice! The rooms have obviously recently been renovated and everything is shiny and new. The beds are comfy and rooms quiet. Great location, free wi fi as well as robe and slippers on my bed when I arrived. Did I mention a chocolate and weather report on my pillow at night? Great little touches which make a stay memorable. The guys at the front desk were so accommodating with all my requests, they even offered to check me in for flight and out print my boarding pass, amazing service I have never experienced anywhere in the world! They were still doing renovations on then front section of the hotel, so the gym area is dusty and noisy, however they did warn me on arrival this was the case. This did not effect my stay in any way. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to LA who wants a great location, nice boutique hotel and amazing service. I honestly did not want to leave :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ilove-europ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel just for night because we live only 30 miles away but wanted a little weekend get away. I love the location! That is the best part. You can walk to tons of eating places and tons of shopping options too. The food options are out of this world! Bakeries, excellent restaurants, old school places mixed with new hot spots, etc. The grove and farmer's market are a quick 10 min walk. If you need to go to any other tourist areas, it would be a short drive/cab. The staff was very friendly and helped us out with any questions. The parking fee is high, but that's how it is everywhere in LA. The pool looked a little small with only a few chairs. I would have hoped for just a few more lounge chairs next time. The rooms were a decent size and I think we had a newer room because the carpet and bathroom were very nice. There were other rooms that looked under construction but we could not hear them. I loved the comfy bed and couch. There was a 24 hour room service offered, but we didnt use it. I will stay here again next time, but request a new room and hope that I get a chair by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “American Girl Doll stay”
Reviews.Author: AmySD
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at The Orlando for the American Girl Doll package - package includes the doll beds and breakfast vouchers. They discounted our valet parking to $15. Each girl got an American Girl Doll bed (which you can only get from this partner hotel). Paul Gardner provided excellent service contacting me the night before, welcoming me and to get the names of the girls and their dolls to write special hand written notes to the girls and their dolls. He also gave us a pleasant surprise of an early check in before noon. Front desk staff were happy and energetic, certainly made me feel the same way. The hotel is walking distance to the Grove. Lots of cool shops, restaurants, boutiques in the area. Close to The Ivy, $5 cab ride to get our Ivy Gimlet. My only concern was the room service menu prices need to be updated, when the food came the pricing was more than the menus so hopefully they will change that next time, we ordered coffee that was $3 on the menu, but ended being $8 but they removed the charge due to the price discrepancy (and it didn't taste much better thena the in-room coffee). Excellent stay we will be staying there again and recommending them to all our American Girl Doll owner friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: elgaz
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner recently stayed in the Orlando during a 3-week holiday in various parts of California and Nevada. We were looking for somewhere in a decent part of LA, and after much investigation and perusal of hotel reviews on this site and other similar ones, we decided to stay at the Orlando Hotel. We were there for 5 nights in total. First impressions were good. The location of the hotel is great; it's situated near La Cienega Boulevard, which seems to be a busy thorougfare intersecting with Santa Monica Bvd, Sunset Bvd, and other busy tourist areas. If you're a tourist, it's really no more than 15 mins or so (traffic depending of course) to some of the famous LA sights such as Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Beverly Hills, Universal, Hollywood Bowl, etc. Directly up the street from the hotel and no more than a 5 minute walk away, is the Beverly Center - which is an upscale shopping center. The brand names (Prada, Gucci, etc) were a little rich for us but nonetheless it's a good way to pass a few hours, and the food court was quite nice. Alternatively you can head down the street for about 10 mins, and you'll come across both the infamous Farmer's Market and the Grove Center. Both are busy places, but a great way to spend a Saturday morning just having an outdoor breakfast and browsing. But anyway - back to the hotel. We got checked in with no problems, and the check-in staff were very helpful and courteous. I should add that this was the case for the duration of our stay; I found the staff more than happy to assist with advice, local information, and also to deal with any issues we had. They also have a 'manager's meeting' from 5-6 every weekday if my memory serves me correctly, and during this period there is complimentary wine & cheese whilst you can chat to staff and relax in the foyer seating area. All very relaxed and hospitable. Now to the negatives. Our room was of an adequate size, but it was obvious that it was long due some refurbishing. There were quite a few carpet stains, and the bathroom (although clean) had obviously seen better days. The room in general looked 'tired'. Asides from the stains though, it was clean and had all the usual amenities that you would expect. There was also a fair bit of noise and the presence of numerous builders outside our room due to ongoing building work. It appeared that some of the rooms were indeed undergoing the refurbishment which I just mentioned - now whilst it was encouraging to see the hotel giving them something of a makeover, it would have been nice if we had actually been told there would be extensive work and noise occurring on our floor whilst we were there. This was never mentioned to us in either our booking through Hotels.com, or by the staff whilst we were there. Nevertheless, we chose not to make an issue of it as we were out for the majority of the time and the workers were usually gone when we got back. Just make sure to ask if about it if you're hoping to have a few late mornings in bed! The pool was something we were hoping to use when there. We were slightly dismayed to find that it's actually tiny - the pictures on the hotel website make it look much larger. I doubt you could actually do much swimming in it, but it would be fine for cooling down in hot weather I suppose. There was no eating area or bar in the hotel, so if you want breakfast/lunch/dinner you'll have to go out. There are however, a number of decent establishments along the same street. I recommend Doughboys which is a 5 min walk away - great breakfasts and lunches, and very reasonably priced. My last gripe with the hotel was the valet parking, which is $35 per day. This seemed extortionate. We instead left the car at the large car park directly opposite the Beverly Center, which charges only $9 for staying overnight. It is closed at night and has security barriers, so we had no worries about leaving the car there overnight. Again, it's a 5 minute walk to the hotel but the saving makes it worthwhile. All in all, I liked the Orlando Hotel but at this stage, I would only rate our experience as average. However, if the problems I mentioned were addressed (room refurbishment, presence of a breakfast bar/room, lower parking rates), the Orlando could raise it's game substantially - it already has a great location and great staff, that little bit extra would do wonders for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: emmadyl
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and very nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: socaldl
Reviews.Content: Located near Beverly Center. Basic, comfortable, clean rooms. Amazing and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: redjen98
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Orlando while visiting friends. When I called to confirm my reservation, they had us down for 2 queens instead of a king. When I pointed out that we had reserved a king they were hesitant to change is (stating that they were full for the weekend) but called me back in 5 minutes and stated that not only would we have a king bedroom we would be placed in one of the newly upgraded rooms. The room was beautiful (especially the bathroom!) with a wonderful view of the pool. Everything was clean and smelled brand new. There were a few things we thought were odd 1. No door on the shower. The floor was covered in water. 2. Last minute details had been left undone (a cord stuffed up into the ceiling in the bathroom, the door needed repainting where the old locks had been pulled off, some of the furniture/mini bar were scuffed) I'm not sure if they placed us in an "almost finished" room and planned to come back to those details...but it really didn't affect our stay too much. 3. We appeared to be the only ones staying on our floor. For a hotel that was "booked" there was an eerie sense of isolation around us. We LOVED! 1. The room had lots of space! Our two year old had more then enough room to spread out his books and read on the bed or the couch. He was in heaven, and WE loved that we weren't right on top of each other. 2. The toiletries. I know it's silly, but the soaps were AMAZING! I wish I could have bought a "regular size" set to take home with me. 3. The robe, slippers, and pillow mints made us feel like we were in a luxury hotel. 4. Customer service is wonderful! We will definitely be staying at the Orlando again. It was a wonderful experience for a fabulous price!

Reviews.Title: “Becareful!”
Reviews.Author: crixie
Reviews.Content: I was in a 4 nights trip with my daughter. The location was great but the room was old. The carpet is a stain festival we didn' t walk barefoot in the room. The mini bar didn't cold, the air condioner was really noisy. As it is on 3rd street is a noisy place all night long and as the windows are not good you hear people talking at night from the street. The bathroom was extremely small and old. Personal is very friendly and they are going on in remodeling the building, it deserves it!. The cozy restaurant I saw in pictures doesn't exists. The free internet access was a good thing too. My advice, ask for a remodeled room and ask if the remodelation has finished. I wouldnt stay again in this condition. The relation price and what you get doesn't value your money. Nice beds and sheets, towels and robes are great. Orlando Hotel you have so much to work on !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: jermtheworm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before... Good size rooms, clean, free internet (when I stayed), coffee , room safe, good shower. has adjoining rooms if required. Ideal to walk to Farmers Market, La Brae Tar Pits, Peterson Auto museum and Los Angeles Art Museum. Some great residential roads close by to explore the local houses and gardens. Only downside is that the sound proofing between adjoining rooms is not 100%. Does not detract though really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping, service could be improved but a great stay overall”
Reviews.Author: Miguel M
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 2 nights at The Orlando Hotel last June. The check in was a little bumpy as they could not locate my reservation even though I had a print-out with me of the actual reservation from their system. But eventually we got a room and it was quite comfortable and I would say spacious too. We had two double beds and I have to admit their beddding was excellent. The gym is really not existent and the pool is quite small but we were there to enjoy West Hollywood, so staying our hotel room was the last thing we wanted to do. The best location to the shops for sure, the Grove, Farmer's market, Beverly Center are all within reasonable walking distance. WeHo, is also close by so hit the LGBT bars they are awesome for a great fun night out with the girls. We ate breakfast once at the restaurant and it was okay but there are pleny of restaurants around. We would like to stay here again but it's not a cheap hotel by any means -- although for boutique West Hollywood hotel I think prices here are pretty competitive. Overall we had a great stay and we love to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Danzy-Eire
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent for visiting LA, 5 minutes to the Beverly Shopping Center and within walking distance to The Grove and Farmers Market. Many more boutique shops and restaurants on West 3rd street also. The Beverly Center is a stop on the StarLine hop on/off tour bus which is useful for sight seeing. Comfortable beds, large screen tv, free internet in reception room off lobby. Sun terrace with loungers and pool. Room service breakfast also available. The hotel is undergoing renovations at the moment (weekdays only). Following disruption on our first morning the hotel staff moved us on our last night to ensure no further impact. Renovated rooms look well, main change is the upgraded bathrooms. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation to those looking for a relaxed sight seeing/ shopping visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: crash311
Reviews.Content: As a female traveling alone, I appreciate the attentiveness of the staff because they know who comes and goes and it makes me feel safe. The hotel has been recently remodeled and has a very modern yet comfortable feel to it. It is close to fabulous shopping, and when my husband travels with me, we walk to the Farmer's Market for breakfast. The best thing about the hotel is the staff. They are eager to take care of your every need, and they do it with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service I have ever experienced....”
Reviews.Author: amandajane7775
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say..... The staff at this hotel are totally amazing. My sister and I had never been to Los Angeles before and if it was not for the staff and all the help they gave us we would have probably spend the entire week in the hotel.... I asked the most stupid of questions (as I had never been to the USA before) and they were only too pleased to help me out, I would even go as far as saying they went over and above their job duties to help. The Restaurant served the most amazing italian food - cooked to perfection and breakfast was lovely too.. The restaurant and reception area are very clean and up to date and look amazing. The rooms were more than adequate for our needs and they were clean. I appreciate the coments that some of the other visitors have made about the rooms needing updating but as far as I am concerned who cares what the rooms look like, as long as they are clean and tidy thats all that matters. At the end of the day you are in LA, one of the most amazing cities I have ever been too so your hotel should only be used for sleeping in.... I would definitely recommend this hotel and cant wait to go back.....

Reviews.Title: “I strongly suggest you stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: CapsizedSailor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a dramatic let down. We paid a premium to stay here for the New Year weekend thinking it'd be worth it given the boutique style and decent reviews. The first thing we noticed was the smell--in the halls before even reaching our room, it was like death masked with loads of air freshener. The second thing we noticed was blood and other stains on our drapes as we began settling in. We requested a room with a second bed or pull-out and they gave us a room with a couch (not pull-out) then tried charging us $15/night for a nasty roll-away, also with blood stains on it. As other reviewers have mentioned, the ice machines were broken, air-conditioner was broken, safe was broken, wireless was broken. Lastly, the staff was unaccomodating and absolutely not qualified to run a hotel. When we called to have some of these issues dealt with, the managers did not return phone calls as promised, they were slow/ineffective with repairs, and not once in 4 days did any of the desk staff ask us how our stay was or offer to compensate us for the time we spent dealing with room problems instead of hanging out with our friends and family. This place is a total armpit albeit with a convincing facade. Absolutely not worth the money--stay at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaCuisine
Reviews.Content: Booked weeks in advance for a room with 2 beds. On arrival, was put in a room with one bed and a pull-out, told the entire hotel was booked, and they would send someone to make up the pull-out bed for us. Ok, fine. Room was incredibly stuffy and the air conditioner / heater didn't work. Even with the noisy, rattling fan running around the clock, the room was muggy. Window was locked shut. Bathroom fan didn't work. Ice machine broken. Wierd mushy, square pillows. Sheets were itchy, with a chemical smell, and there was some kind of lumpy yet slippery mattress pad underneath that made the sheets tangle as I tossed and turned all night in futile search of sleep. For $184/night + $30/day parking, I expected something at least as comfortable as a Travelodge or Motel 6. The staff was friendly but obviously helpless to do anything to resolve anything for us. Location is about the only thing going for this place. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Daryl1212
Reviews.Content: My Brother and I just spent seven nights (broken up over three stays) at the Orlando and had thouroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is clean and comfortable and well appointed. Yes in some rooms it does take a while for the hot water to reach the room but that is a small inconveinenince and the super friendly staff more than make up for that. All the staff from the valet guys to the cleaning staff to the desk staff are great and really helpful. On the last stay which was a stop over after coming back from Peru and before we left for Australia we needed an early check in and a late check out due to the unusual flight schedules and the staff were more than willing to accomodate us. Lastly This hotel is in an incredible location in West Hollywood, it is close to everything (restaurants, shopping entertainment etc) and if you are driving it is easy to get anywhere from here. We will stay there again in a couple of years when my family visits the US next.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: baboo217
Reviews.Content: We got to LA without a hotel reservation so we quickly found something on the Internet. When we got there the front desk gave us a free upgrade which was so nice. When we got to the room they even called to make sure the room was ok for me(never had that before) the room was big but it wasn't the best of life. It was just good enough but the service really made up for what the room was lacking. Really it just needs an update but (the bathroom) it was great for our immediate needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Stunifoo
Reviews.Content: This is a great value for the neighborhood in Los Angeles. Orlando is a nice hotel with exceptionally friendly staff, in a great location near the Beverly Center. You can walk to so many great restaurants and interesting stores. They have breakfast in the hotel or there are a couple of wonderful choices right down the block. Rooms are on the small size, but adequate and they could use more convenient outlets for charging, but those are small criticisms. It's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando- Best Value, Best Location, Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hudtm
Reviews.Content: You will not find better value or better location or more helpful staff in any boutique establishment at this this level. Have been staying here with groups for many years and the attraction is the location and homey feel. It may sound grandiose to say this but it is the one hotel in the world that we consistently return too, and we are never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great. Everything was great.”
Reviews.Author: ABretail
Reviews.Content: My stay in the hotel was really great - the people were nice and the service was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great looks but poor structual amenities”
Reviews.Author: LVGreen
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is fantastic, the decoration is beautiful and trendy, the location is pretty good, but the structural amenities like carpet and bathrooms need some serious upgrades. If you're gonna take an old hotel and update it, decorating it nicely is not enough. But overall worth the price I guess.

Reviews.Title: “overrated, needs updating, hardly boutique”
Reviews.Author: nypoppa
Reviews.Content: stayed for two nights after a four night stay in a legitimate 4+ star hotel in Santa Monica - needed to be in west LA/hollywood - my wife and other family members had stayed at the orlando over the past few years and thought it would be a good choice - the staff were all friendly and helpful but the hotel is dreary, needs new paint, carpet and bathrooms - the room while a bit small would have been fine for a few nites if the bathroom was newer and felt cleaner - also, the pool is a no more than an oversized hot tub which was not hot/heated even with the temperature in the 80's - unappealing few chairs in a small area which was sort of dark when the sun moved in the mid afternoon - the best thing is the location if you need to be in this area and there are plenty of good fun restaurants and shops within walking distance which is a big deal in LA

Reviews.Title: “Great Find. Excellent Service in a Central Location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromNYCMIA
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise to find a well-appointed, small hotel in the heart of it all. The staff were excellent. The rooms were very comfortable with good bedding. I'll definitely be back here. The restaurant at the hotel is also quite good!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, friendly and professional staff, lovely small hotel. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: jillny2000
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here my last 2 visits to L.A. Very reasonably priced, cool vibe, nice rooms, good amenities, great bed!I I have stayed in the finest hotels in the world, and even though this is just a small boutique hotel, I think it holds its own and I will stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “For our first trip to LA, the Orlando was a great location for an introduction to the city”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen7375
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to discover The Orlando Hotel on a trip to visit our son who recently moved to Los Angeles. The location was ideal. There are lots of great restaurants within walking distance (the "Little Next Door" is a fabulous place for a real French "petit dejuner" - we lived in France for 6 years and it brought back great memories). The front-desk staff was very helpful with our reservations and advice on rerstaurants and places to visit. I never thought I'd say this, but I would recommend taking a Hollywood tour - it was really interesting. There are lots of options for this and other tours, and the hotel staff set ours up so that we were picked up at the hotel. Our room was a nice size with a king bed and sitting area. Internet is free! The hotel offered everything we were looking for and more. This is definitely a deal and a great place to stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Neat boutique hotel, great service, would return again”
Reviews.Author: phoenikia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 night in October 2010. I almost changed my reservation to the Elan, which has one of the highest TA ratings I've ever seen for a 3 star hotel, but decided to stick with my first choice. Nice quiet room with a comfortable bed, great location close to restaurants. Walking distance to the Grove. The bathroom was spotless, and I loved that the hotel provided Bulgari soaps and moisturizers. Plush, quality towels, too. I opted for the breakfast included package. While the breakfast is limited, with just 4 hot options and a few cold, continental items on the buffet, the spinach, zucchini, cherry tomato and mushroom frittata was delicious, and l liked the banana bread. The servers in the restaurant were outgoing, and made this single traveller feel welcome each morning. If I return to the Orlando, I would probably get the regular room rate in the future, and order breakfast separately. The front desk was very helpful. No complaints. The atmosphere is low-key, and geared more towards travellers than tourists. No grand lobby, but there is small lobby/library near the elevators with a tv, and internet terminal. This isn't a place for someone who is looking to be pampered or coddled. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A stinky hotel with system glitches - don't ever stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cavergirl
Reviews.Content: We go to LA for several weekends during the fall/winter to attend football games. We usually stay at a hotel downtown but their rates were bumped up for parents weekend so we decided to try another hotel. We made the mistake of booking at the Orlando. The staff was nice and welcoming when we checked in. After we settled into the room, we noticed a funny smell in the bathroom (a sulphur smell) but hurried out to grab some lunch. When we got back to the room, I decided to take a shower and wash my hair before attending our night game. The soap and shampoo fragrance masked the odor but of course when I got out of the shower, I had to spend some time at the sink getting my hair dry and styled and apply makeup. By the time I was done (and I was rushing), I was very afraid I would literally throw up my lunch. The smell was just horrid. We called the front desk and they dispatched an engineer to check out the smell. When he arrived, he walked in the bathroom, took a few sniffs around the toilet and said it definitely smelled bad and asked if we would like a different room. Gee? Yuh think? I told him we did and he said he would inform the front desk. My husband went into the bathroom after the engineer left and he sniffed around and determined the smell was actually coming from the bypass drain in the sink. He called the front desk and told them that we discovered where the smell was coming from that the engineer was unable to determine and thought that info might help. They told us that there were no other rooms available at the time but they would move us once there were. About 2 hours later, we were finally moved to another room which did not smell. The bathroom was much nicer than the original bathroom which had mold in the shower/tub area, a very poorly patched and partly molding ceiling, and a chipped vanity counter. FYI - we had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and heard about the outdated bathrooms but we were told all the bathrooms now were updated. If that is the case, they did a very cheap job considering the grouting is already molding, wallpaper peeling, and counter top chipping. In all fairness to the hotel, the staff was very nice and helped us with meal reservations in the area. When we left, we were told by the front desk staff that they noticed we had booked some other weekends and would make sure we had nice rooms when we returned. We decided that the location was not as convenient as our regular hotel and the hotel in general was much nicer so we went on-line to the Orlando website and cancelled the other 2 weekends we had reserved. Fast forward 2 weeks and we headed off to LA for the next game weekend and a stay at our regular hotel. During our stay, we noticed that we had received an email from the front desk staff at the Orlando saying they were looking forward to our visit. When we got home, we e-mailed them to say that we cancelled our reservations (and referenced the cancellation numbers) as the our regular hotel was more geographically convenient for us (we didn't go into all the stink issues) and wanted to be sure we were not charged a "no show" fee. Sure enough after some research on their end, they sent us an email apologizing for having charged a no show fee due to "a glitch in our system" and assured us they had already issued a refund. We strongly suggest you consider another hotel for a visit to the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: TXtravelerHouston
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great and friendly staff, it is also conveniently situated between the Beverly center, the farmers market and the Grove. Great restaurants: Toast, Joanâ€™s on Third and Doughboys, which are frequented by celebrities if that is your thing, but the hotel does not live up to the pictures posted online. When we first arrived we had a problem with our card keys and it took a bit getting into the room. The air-condition in the room was horrible, the thermostat read at 63 degrees, it felt like 82 in our room. We all woke up with a stuffy nose from the muggy warm air in our room. I wish I could post some pics up for you all to see, but I can not at the moment. We stayed in the Luxury two queen size room and it was so small, but the restroom was even smaller- it is really outdated (no wonder they donâ€™t show pictures of the RR.) Our room faced the pool area. I am glad I did not have use for the pool, but it was super small. To give you an idea, smaller than some pools in budget motel/hotels. I am sorry, but there is nothing boutique or trendy about this hotel and would definitely not recommend staying here for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Lower End Beverly Hills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doormold
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in April 2010, when we traveled to Beverly Hills to attend a wedding. For Beverly Hills, the rooms were very affordable, at $159 per night (booked directly on the hotel web site). There is no garage, but our room rate included valet parking, so we felt like we didn't get gouged on the overall hotel cost. The room itself was clean and comfortable, with plenty of room for the two of us. The king sized bed was great, with lots of pillows. The TV screen was large and we took advantage of the in-room refrigerator and desk. The only thing that really annoyed us was a run in with a bell hop upon arrival. We are self-sufficient people who chose to haul our own luggage. Because we had several suitcases, evening gown and tuxedos bags, we needed to use a luggage cart. We actually had to fight with the bell hop to let us handle the thing ourselves! He told us that he was going to get fired if he didnâ€™t take responsibility for the luggage cart, which we found to be ridiculous and told the Front Desk so. The hotel is close to the Beverly Center, and I actually walked down the main drag to find a hair stylist for my wedding hair up-do. There are plenty of restaurants if you donâ€™t mind walking a few blocks. Overall, a good stay for the money and we would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings.”
Reviews.Author: absolutangel21
Reviews.Content: This was an entirely sufficient hotel in an entirely awesome location. That said, I was a little disappointed. For starters, the bedding was in my top 5 for most uncomfortable hotel bed experiences. The mattress was like sleeping on a concrete slab and the pillows were basically non-existent. The room itself was nice; a little cramped, but nice. It seemed to me that it was a very old hotel that had only been moderately updated with the latest furnishings. It wasn't as flashy & fancy as the website had made it out to be. The front desk associates were always friendly and greeted us with a smile every time we'd return to the hotel. The valets were helpful and as equally amicable. I would recommend this hotel if you're on a budget and looking to stay in a fabulous location, but not if you're looking for a fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Motel-like room, no good location”
Reviews.Author: roomservice99
Reviews.Content: The room we were given was quite large but had a very low ceiling. It is furnished modernly but looks a bit like a student's home. The room seemed renovated but they kept structures like the room entrance door and the bathroom facilities which looked cheap and made us feel as in a motel. The bathroom was very small. When turning on the tap the water would not drain away but fill the sink up. The toilet flush was very weak. Then there was a constant noise coming out of the A/C opening even though it was completely turned off. This was very annoying at night. The next day I complained about it. Later I found out myself by opening the bathroom ceiling that several water pipes passed behind the A/C opening which were running all the time. Who could sleep with that noise? I helped myself by sticking newspaper on the outside so I could reduce the noise for the night. The hotel is located in the center between Beverly Hills and West Hollywood which sounds great. But you will still need a car to go anywhere else than the road it is on. Their valet parking is at $29 per day. I used it for the first day but wasn't charged upon checkout. I've used the parking which is at $9 per day. The day of checkout the room cleaning entered the room at 8 am while we were still asleep. Later, at around 10 am they knocked again. They should have known that we were leaving and they don't need to clean until after we have checked out. Also the minibar wasn't filled up. Because of all this I wasn't satisfied. I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Orlando is a gem in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelpro2
Reviews.Content: We love staying in small boutique hotels, and The Orlando was the perfect choice. The contemporary decor was great. We loved our large room and the service was excellent. The valet service was speedy. We loved the location. You could walk to many restaurants and shopping. Also, the hotel is directly across from the famous Magnolia's Bakery, so cupcakes were readily available!! We will stay here again! Also, the small hotel even has a restaurant and a small heated pool and exercise room - quite a bonus for a hotel of this size. We highly recommend The Orlando!!
