Reviews.Title: “If ONLY I had been able to stay there.....”
Reviews.Author: namaste1969
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night "Urban Retreat" package which included valet for just under $200, a good deal by WH/BH standards. My husband & I had tickets for a show at a club around the corner so the location was perfect and the reviews on Tripadvisor were mostly excellent. The morning we were supposed to check in, I received a message from the hotel asking if they could make any reservations etc. Nice. We got in the car for the hour drive (it was more of a staycation for us as we're local) at around 2:00 pm. My phone rang at 2:05 advising us our room was no longer available, they had overbooked and were sending us to the Thompson Beverly Hills. What? An hour before check in? I checked Tripadvisor and the reviews for the Thompson were awful. I called the hotel back and asked if there was anything that could be done to rectify this situation. She was very nice but no. The Orlando would pick up the charge for the Thompson. Needless to say, the reviews on the Thompson were spot on. Small rooms, no coffee maker (which the Orlando indicates they have and for which I spent an extra $25 for coffee in the AM), and upon check out they attempted to charge me $30 for parking. Further, they charged me about $50 more than the cost of the Orlando. So, I didn't get to stay at the Orlando at the very last minute, I paid more for a hotel I did not like, and I sent an email to the Orlando asking them to request the Thompson refund the overage with no response. Will I stay at the Orlando in the future? I guess I have to now so I can actually write a review about their hotel. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem”
Reviews.Author: dabbler45
Reviews.Content: The customer service here is extraordinary. It began before our stay when I contacted the General Manager, Tohnia Miller, because of some confusion about whether my package included breakfast. Her response was prompt and welcoming and was a reflection of the warmth of all of the staff with whom we had contact. The room was great and the bed was one of the best I've ever slept on. It is true that the bathrooms are a little worn and that the noise between connecting rooms can be a problem. However, I understand the the hotel will be undergoing a major renovation this fall that will take care of both of these problems. Also, travelers should be aware that the pool is very small, more of a "soaking" than "swimming"pool.

Reviews.Title: “Just not quite there...”
Reviews.Author: decasto
Reviews.Content: This hotel might be trying but they've still got a ways to go. It's in an excellent location and the property itself looks attractive enough, but it's very rough around the edges. Upon checking in (at approx 430p) we were told our room was not ready due to a change out of mattresses. We were invited to a glass of champagne (a nice touch) and were told we could wait for our room up by the pool. No effort was made to ask if we wanted our bags stored or to help us with carrying them to the pool....but we made no fuss and dragged them up to the 2nd floor to wait. We were also told we were being "upgraded" but turns out the room specs were exactly what I ordered in the first place....hmmm. Anyhow, after finally checking in about an hour later we found the room to be "fine" but not really worth $180 a night. Mold in the shower and grout that was BADLY in need of replacement was not a great welcome. Had issues with the toilet as well. The real kicker was returning for the night and finding out room had not been cleaned. They replaced towels but...forgot to clean the room??? By the time we returned to the room it was midnight and not worth making a fuss but I just don't see how that can be overlooked. Overall I'd have to say I would not recommend this hotel and there are just too many other places to stay when we're in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando hotel in LA is the best”
Reviews.Author: vintagenut
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Orlando hotel in LA on 3rd street. The hotel is quiet, clean, and comfortable, with an awesome location and a wonderfully attentive staff. This is a gem of a hotel, suitable for business or pleasure, and is just blocks from the LA Farmers Market/The Grove, trendy restaurants, Magnolia Bakery, Joan's Bakery on Third, and many boutique shops. You'll likely not need a car in this fabulous location. Forget the big chain hotes This is the one you want. It a saltwater pool, fitness room, and wonderful restaurant with tapas style dining in in-house pastry chef.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - return visit was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: susan0660
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the hotel several years ago and found the location, hotel, and restaurant superb. However, upon returning this year, the restaurant was abysmal. The continental breakfast was included in our rate, but the staff could only cook omelets or scramble eggs. Further, their interpretation of "french toast" was a slice of baguette toasted. Only one kind of bread and cheese availabile at breakfast - not the elegant, European spread of several years ago. Furthermore, on my prior visit, the restaurant got excellent reviews and was also a draw for stars in the evening and now few people dine in it . Our dinner was equally disappointing and in retrospect we should have dined at one of the highly rated restaurants on Third Street.. If you stay here, stay away from the restaurant. The location is fabulous and the staff is quite pleasant. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. However, the bathrooms are in dire need of renovation. My husband is tall and the ceiling above our bathrub was quite low and as a consequence he had to be constantly aware to not raise up his arm or it would hit the ceiling. Upon departing, I spoke with the hotel reception regarding the restaurant as we had continually heard other guests complaining at breakfast, and they assured me that issue was being addressed. I will give it another chance in the future due to the fabulous location and quiet, but I would not rate it a four star hotel any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JackieSue1
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Orlando Hotel. It is conveniently located and within walking distance to Cedars Sinai, Beverly Mall, the Farmers Market/Grove, and numerous restaurants. The hotel has a small workout area and pool, responsive and pleasant valet parking, free wi-fi, very comfortable beds, complementary breakfast (for my room), and all the apples you could want. A USA today was at my door each morning, and hospitality did a great job on my room each night. If I need to go to the area again, I will definitely stay at the Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Best Overall Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnjaBlue
Reviews.Content: This is the best kept secret in Los Angeles. The rooms are cozy and have everything you could possibly need, the location is very functional because it's on the outskirts of a neighborhood of houses, so you can get your deli, your luggage repaired, your shoes fixed, your nails done in between business appointments, and even shop for gifts. there's a restaurant in the lobby with delicious food, and the service is amazing. 10 stars for sure.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Winner !!!”
Reviews.Author: APSCAGuy
Reviews.Content: I was called to LA for business at the very last minute. The Orlando's location was superb for easy access to many prime places of interest. The valet and front desk staff were very hospitable. The room was a very good size, updated to current trends (interiors, flat screen television and wireless internet) and immaculate. Five minutes after I was in the room, the front desk asked if everything was satisfactory: that was great customer service! Special mention: the wireless internet. I'm a business traveler, therefore in-room internet connectivity is a #1 priority: The Orlando's was perfect. From easy check-in/check-out, a very comfortable room (the bed was just right for a good night sleep and shower pressure a delight) and a caring staff to the ease of working in-room: The Orlando provided everything I needed for a great stay in LA. I plan to return to LA again and stay at The Orlando plus book my client's there when they're in LA. The Orlando is an absolute winner!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, will definitely book again”
Reviews.Author: maomis2mimao
Reviews.Content: The orlando was a wonderful hotel, with excellent staff and services. The cost was very reasonable considering the rooms modern design and spaciousness. Staff were very friendly, organizing airport transfers for me. The hotel has a great location, especially if your a shopper. Only a 2min walk from the Beverly Shopping Center and 10 minuets from Farmers Market. Overall I have nothing negative to say about The Orlando, will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & Staff”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because the person who we were meeting for business was staying at this hotel. From the time of our arrival the staff was very friendly. We checked in and we went to our room, which as soon as we walked in the room it smelt like a smoking room. We went to the front desk, who were extremely embarrassed because there is a law in LA that forbids smoking in all hotel rooms. Immediately they upgraded us to a suite, which was unexpected. The room was quite comfortable, great bed and towels. There is free wi-fi, easy to walk to various restaurants and the Beverly Center. The location of the hotel is great. The hotel has a restaurant which we did not eat there. But we did get a beer in their bar, which had a good atmosphere. The restaurant/bar has indoor & outdoor seating. If you have a car, there is a charge for parking, like most cities. We had a great experience and the staff certainly makes your stay special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hidden Gem in Hollywood/LA”
Reviews.Author: SC_4caster
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay in Hollywood/LA. The room was clean, the staff was very friendly and the location was great! It was close to shopping and restaurants. I would recomend staying here and will stay here on my next trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great service”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerChas
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to The Orlando with a group of colleagues -- our fourth stay at the hotel in the past four years in addition to one personal visit. The hotel's attentive service and helpful staff keep us returning time after time; the staff is great at handling the groups requirements while still providing individual service to each guest. I noticed a problem with the wireless internet service (running extremely slow) and called the front desk to inquire . . . I'm used to such calls leading to zero results at most hotels, but at The Orlando, someone was upstairs within 5 minutes to reboot the router which immediately solved the problem. I was able to get tons of work done in the spacious room in between meetings (including one held in the fantastic restaurant off the lobby) and the Third Street location provides plenty of additional dining options. Definitely a property I would recommend for either a business or leisure traveler and certainly somewhere I'll be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Bed Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jessebob
Reviews.Content: I am surprised I didn't know about this place. I travel to L.A. about once every two months and feel I know the city pretty well. After my usual place was sold out, a friend reccomended this hotel to me and I can honestly say I got a new 'place' in L.A. The Orlando is on Third St. which has become one of the hottest spots in L.A. I have actually been to the resturant in the Hotel and never realized there was a hotel attached to it. Although it is cliche to say a 'small European' botique hotel, this place really is that. Everything is nice and personal. From the lobby to the rooms, with some of the best beds I have ever slept in. Cool decor and furniture and really the best locale in the city right now. Service is second to none, special thanks to Marcella who made my reservation and happened to be at the Front Desk when I checked in. She remembered me from the phone, how often does that happen? Cant reccomend this place enough. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “I just discovered this great property”
Reviews.Author: FineF00die
Reviews.Content: I just had the opportunity to discover The Orlando Hotel. I'm familiar with many of the larger name Hollywood area hotels, but this will be my choice from now on. The staff is friendly, accommodating, and you get the feeling that everyone really wants you to have a great stay. And you can't beat the value or the location! Take it from an experienced traveler... this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “my stay at the Orlando”
Reviews.Author: kkjMt
Reviews.Content: We stayed almost a week the front desk was very friendly and helpful, they help me with setting up a rental car, gave us great directions to different locations, they were all very accommodating. The only thing I have negative to say about that hotel is the restaurant; it is very expensive for a centennial breakfast (meat slices and yogurt). I would suggest the Berryâ€™s down the street, for the same price you get a great breakfast. Also two days before we left the house keepers didnâ€™t restock, so I had to call they did come up right away to do it but the next day they never even came in our room to clean it and received the daily paper was very sporadic, get it one day but not the other. They defiantly need to work on consistency but besides that the hotel itself is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful European Stlye Boutique Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ericaguitar
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay at the Orlando Hotel. I was in town for my friend's bachellorette party and the convenient location to West Hollywood allowed us to go from venue to venue with ease. The surrounding restaurants, boutiques and shops all along 3rd street makes this area one of the only areas in LA you can get by without having a car. I highly recommend the hotel as the staff was excellent and the whole experience was very warm and welcoming. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “nice from the outside - but hidden issues from the inside”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyMontana
Reviews.Content: at first the hotel seemed nicely located and stylish to some extend. However during the night one could hear every conversation the neighbors had; and in the morning once the they took their showers I was catapulted out of bed - it sounded like a rocket taking of! Additionally, the sheets were not clean and had stains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Last Minute Find”
Reviews.Author: Tachiebluebird
Reviews.Content: Another hotel recommended we try the Orlando for rooms since they were sold out -- we arrived around midnight after flying in from the East Coast to escape the snow. The lobby was nicely decorated with a Mac computer for guest use and an adjoining TV/lounge room. Staff was very helpful while en route to the hotel as we tried to find a place for the weekend and were pleasant during our entire stay. You can tell from the room that this is an older property that has been updated with the boutique look - it smelled a little funky, the bathrooms are not the greatest, and we had lukewarm/tepid water during our entire stay (they gave us some breakfast coupons to compensate.) This is definitely not a 4-star hotel, more like a 3-star. However, we spent two great nights here - it was so quiet and the bed exceptionally comfortable - and Third offers a number of places to eat and shop you can easily walk to. And the internet worked great in the room. I would not recommend the breakfast, it was a bizarre buffet and made to order hot items. We were lucky to get a hotel in this area as a walkin on Valentine's weekend - our rate of $200 was competitive but I read that lower prices may be available when booking in advance through hotel /travel web sites. I would recommend this hotel and would probably stay here again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to Stay At”
Reviews.Author: BassEngineering
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. Clean, good location, safe, and very pleasant atmosphere. I truly felt very comfortable. I plan on staying here again and will reccomend my friends to stay here also. A nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ShawnaT1
Reviews.Content: Best boutique hotel ever!!! The breakfast was included and it was amazing. They also gave us taxi vouchers for every night we stayed there, so the parking was virtually free. The staff was wonderful and the room was picture perfect!!! Talk about a beautiful, clean, comfortable bed! My kids and I loved this hotel!! I would give it more stars if I could! After I returned I received a letter from them thanking me for my stay...hand signed! First class all the way! Well worth the money. The location was also great, walking distance to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel - Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: WilliamNYChelsea
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at The Orlando and had a great experience! All of the staff was exceptional - from the valet, to the desk and restaurant. For a very reasonable price, we had a nice sized room, extremely comfortable bed and a nice little balcony with very sound-proof French doors. We enjoyed both the food and drink in the restaurant downstairs and this location cannot be beat. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star as promised from Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: fidlfreek
Reviews.Content: No insulation in walls and could hear clearly conversations next door, not to mention normal door closing sounded like slamming. The room was generally nice but shoddy construction in the bathroom, the ceiling etc. Just not 4 star. The management was nice and the 5th floor room was perfectly sufficient. Book the boutique, nonsmoking 4 star on Hotwire and this is what you end up w/ (in Beverly Hills, and West Hollywood area). Just be aware that this is not the lux property with the polished detail and high quality everything that 4 star implies. Frankly I'm sad that Hotwire hasn't adjusted their star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel to go back to after a day of sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: girlirish
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the orlando. The staff were very helpful and had excellent customer service skills. We had a double room which was massive with two extremely comfortable beds, the decor of the room was modern and the in room amenities were excellent. The location of the hotel was great just a short taxi ride from Hollywood, the Beverly Centre was a five minute walk away which is very handy as you dont have far to carry your shopping. The area was quiet and we felt safe at night walking around. The hotels restaurant was very nice at both breakfast time and dinner time. Joans on third is a two minute walk from the hotel and is a lovely place to have breakfast. Just a tip if you are staying here and getting a taxi back to the hotel and anywhere in general in los angeles have the complete address of your destination written down including post/zip code as we found it quiet frustrating at times with taxi drivers as they didnt know where we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “no higher than 3 stars for sure”
Reviews.Author: LanigirlHB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because Hotwire rated it as a 4 star hotel but it was such a disappointment from the start. The first room we were given had major air conditioning equipment outside our window. Then we were moved to another room which was better but not really cleaned good enough. Outside of our room was the pool area and the pool was the smallest pool I had ever seen. Valet parking is overpriced at $29 per night and they were going to charge us a 1/2 day rate for the 2nd day when we actually didn't stay for the 2nd night we prepaid for and left the hotel at 6pm. Plus, we left the hotel at 9:30am to go sightseeing the 2nd day and just came back to pack up and leave which only meant that we parked for 45 minutes and they were still trying to charge us for the parking. Bull----!!! This really left a bad taste in our mouths. I will never ever return to this hotel. Hotwire truly misrepresented this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, great service - would like to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: lyra23
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed - especially after a long flight! The room was spacious and very nicely decorated. The staff were really helpful during our stay, and as we had a late night flight on the day we checked out, they stored our luggage and offered us the full facilities of the hotel while we were waiting. We didn't have a car for that part of the trip, but there was lots of shops and cafes close-by, including the Beverly Centre (and cinema), a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf cafe, supermarkets and The Farmer's Market. Everything you could need basically. I thought it was good value, booked through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, too far away from everything”
Reviews.Author: JeanniesDiary
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Hotwire, also 4* in the West Hollywood area. Iam a solo traveller and found this hotel to be too far away from everything. I like to be in an area which is a safe walking distance to main strip for restaurants etc. Although the Orlando had a few restaurants around it (within 10 minutes walk) I didn't feel safe walking back to the hotel after dark. I found the rooms to be very good - huge rooms with a very comfortabel bed and I thought the bathroom was fine. Yes the lifts and the hallways are extremely dated however this didn't bother me as the room was not. Although small, the pool was lovely and I have to say the staff were great. Although close to the beverly centre and not too far from the outdoor shopping centre (about 10-15 minutes) I was disappointed with the location and will next time stay somewhere closer to the Strip in true West Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms could use a facelift”
Reviews.Author: MItraveler21
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in West Hollywod a few times. We took a chance with hotwire 4 star West Hollywood/Beverly Hills. We had never heard of this hotel. For the price, this hotel was a deal. The rooms are dated and the bathroom was small. The staff was great! This hotel is 2 blocks from the Beverly Center.

Reviews.Title: “ok stay, room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: the_jetset_chick
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Orlando for 3 nights at the beginning of a roadtrip. The location is superb, the staff friendly, the rooms largish. But some things could do with some improvement. The main reason, why I have only given 3 stars instead of 4 is the state of the bathrooms. They are not renovated and really outdated, it wasn't a pleasure getting ready in there. Generally, the hotel could do with an overhaul- "boutique" is maybe a little OTT, good midrange hotel would more pinpoint it. We got an amazing deal at hotwire though, so I won't complain.... Valet was incredibly expensive- 29$ a day... but I guess that's LA hotel prices....

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: kyz04
Reviews.Content: I Recently travelled around the US with friends for four weeks and stayed at another hotel in LA for 5 nights before leaving for Anaheim for 2 days and returning to LA for 2 nights before flying home and thought we would try another hotel. Big mistake, I knew from the moment we entered the hotel we would be disappointed as even the entrance doesn't look anything like their photos. The hallway towards our room was so dark due to lights not working we couldn't even see where to use our key to get into the room. The bed was as hard as a rock, carpet was sticky and the bathroom looked like it was from an old motel with a running toilet. We couldn't even bare to stay one night and end our fantastic holiday in this disappointing hotel so we made immediate arrangements to return to our previous hotel which was amazing. The best thing I can say about the hotel is it was walking distance to the Beverly Centre the perfect getaway while we figured out alternative accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lagunawoods
Reviews.Content: we were family group of mostly adults and 2 teens. we took up a total of 24 "room nights'. the staff are actually as a amazing as other reviews, so helpful and patient. the hotel was clean, comfortable, and cozy. the beds are really nice, and have good sheets. the rooms are bigger than most hotels. the location is so good for l.a.. you can walk to a million stores and restaurants, ( for l.a this is unusual ). i cannot say a bad word about this hotel. i would definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with killer service”
Reviews.Author: 299mutt
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Orlando was our first time in a hotel with our 10 month old boy and the staff really took care of us and made it as easy as could be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: awilliams42
Reviews.Content: This is the best location with the biggest rooms for the price. I was pleased to find what I needed at an affordable rate and walking distance from great shopping and restaurants. The bed was big and fluffy and I couldn't wait to sink into it after a long day. The hotel restaurant had a great Spinach pasta too.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what else people could expect.”
Reviews.Author: JasmineWong
Reviews.Content: Ok, I booked this hotel through an online service which didn't reveal the name of the hotel until I booked. Once I booked and the name was revealed I of course did a full online review search only to land here. I was terrified after reading some of these reviews! The Four Seasons? What? This is not supposed to be The Four Seasons. If you are looking for THAT kind of service, fine. Go there. This hotel is just fine. The rooms are clean and plenty big. I mean we are not living in the hotel. It's just a home base. And a lovely home base it is too. Yes, the bathroom is a little small, could use a little more water pressure, but it's clean and has everything one would need. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and kind. I felt the entire check-in process was as easy as could be. I was up in my room in no time. I must have called the front desk 4 times in 3 minutes about getting my car, changing my mind, and getting a cab. All times Ashley was as pleasant as can be and took amazing care of me. Clean. Check. Friendly. Check. Priced Right. Check. Location. Pretty cool and convenient. Bottom line. There is nothing wrong with this place. I've stayed all over the world in Inter-Continentals, and Hiltons, and Hyatt's, and Ritz's and all the rest. Nothing is wrong here. It's not the Intercontinental, but it doesn't cost that much either. Stay here and be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando - Clean, Simple Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: TucsonDaug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orlando for 2 weekend nights. Each room was average and a little pricey, but not for California. Our rooms did not have the best views - overlooking many businesses roof tops. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was small but the younger ones enjoyed it. If you like no frills just a nice quiet, clean place to stay, you will enjoy the Orlando. I suggest you walk to Joans for a meal. We really liked the food there and atmosphere, but go during off-peak times as it gets really crowded. The farmers' market is a nice stroll away and has exceptional choices for another meal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: ATLgal_7
Reviews.Content: Good location for several days of meetings in the LA area. Very hip, modern, streamlined room. Ample room to spread out and work (write) in the room. Carpet was a bit tired; other than that my stay was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: setravel1012
Reviews.Content: As an entertainment travel agent booking talent and crew with high expectations, it is important that I know first hand the hotel I will be reserving for their engagements. I can tell you from staying at the Orlando recently and from the comments of my clients the mere facts. The Orlando Hotel is great. The rooms are hip and stylish, the beds so comfortable, making you feel like you are in an apartment and not a hotel. This is important when you have clients that are staying multiple nights. The staff is great and make every effort to engage in conversation and get to know you. It's nice to be at a small boutique hotel, where you are not lost in a crowd and made to feel that you are really cared about. As far as the location, I loved the fact that I didn't have to drive and felt comfortable walking in this great area. One day I walked to The Beverly Center, another day The Grove, and even took a 30 minute hike up to the Sunset Strip in West Hollywood. Very, very cool. That is why The Orlando gets my business and I reccommend it to every one I know. Sherry Eiden

Reviews.Title: “No no no! Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Summer717
Reviews.Content: Stupidly forgot to check reviews on tripadvisor.com for this hotel.... how I wished we had! Booked the hotel through their webiste as it showed nice pictures, stated that it had undergone a renovation and it said it was a "luxury" "European style boutique" hotel. The moment we arrived there I was already disappointed with the neighborhood.... not a nice area to be in. The check-in lounge looked cosy and just okay, but nowhere near luxury. I was already starting to feel weary of this hotel, but stepping into the lift, walking out into the corridor, I started to get very worried because it looked like a shabby motel. The room looked nothing like the pictures on the website, there were cup marks on the desk, the coffee table was dirty, the room was dark and it just was all depressing. But when I stepped into the bathroom, I knew I couldn't spend the night there and it was clear why the website didn't show any pictures of the bathroom. It looked like some cheap old motel, and in the sink I saw a string of hair and clipped nail!! I was absolutely disgusted, and immediately opened up my laptop in the room to make use of the free wireless internet to look for another hotel. The 2 nights booked were prepaid and after coming up with some story to tell the front desk, they would only waive one night. Whatever. This hotel is NOT worth paying $200+ a night for! We quickly moved to the Four Seasons Los Angeles ($425 a night) and boy, were we happy to be out of the Orlando. There's NOTHING "luxury" about this hotel, and it's not even close to an European boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oubliez-Ã§a!”
Reviews.Author: Romanbiker
Reviews.Content: We were "relocated" at the Orlando by another hotel. The Orlando turned out to be a big disappointment and a real downgrade. First it was not that easy to find after a long 500 mile drive as the hotel does not have a sign, so had to go around the block twice before finding it. The welcome we got from the valet was â€œAh! "that" hotel sent you?. The Orlando youâ€™ll see is MUCH better. Well it turned out to be MUCH worse. The staff at the reception was pompous and a bit arrogant, told us they were booked out and that they were doing us a great favour to have us (maybe this is why they put us in a room with a bathroom for the disabled?). The bed was uncomfortable, the bathroom not too clean. When, at breakfast, we asked for an orange juice at the usual Latino waiter, he brought me the check ...... We told him the breakfast was included, but no way; we had to face the front desk again and were told the breakfast was complimentary for one guest only (??) It was hard for them to understand we were two of usâ€¦finally they said ok, they would make an exceptionâ€¦wow!. The only good feature of this hotel was its fast internet connection and maybe the location, but there are other hotels in the area with far better service and price. This is no way a 4 star hotel. This is essentially a pretentious little dark joint trying to be a boutique hotel as we have in Europe. Itâ€™s a pity to waste money on The Orlando.Oubliez-Ã§a! (forget it!).

Reviews.Title: “Ok but we expected more”
Reviews.Author: paulus101
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop for 2 nights before heading back to the UK & we had been recommended this hotel before their recent renovation, it was a bit disapponting. The room was clean enough but the bathroom was tired & very cramped. The public area was nice with a free internet pc but the restaurant breakfast was very disappointing, we didn't bother for the 2nd morning we walked down to the Farmers Market instead. The location is pretty good being midway between the Grove & the Beverley Centre,a taxi to Hollywood Blvd was about $35. The open top tour bus stops nearby. Overall we were a bit disillusioned by our 1st visit to LA by the exhorbitent level of tipping expected.

Reviews.Title: “Fun weekend at The Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: hulaskoot
Reviews.Content: My friend comes into town from SF for work often and usually stays at The Orlando. On his last trip, I visited with him for the weekend and we played "tourist," which was fun since the hotel is located right where everything is. We even walked across the street to a store to buy ice cream at midnight! The staff is so friendly and are always helpful. The valet guys were also helpful as we had two cars and were trying to figure out where to park the other one, etc. One day, I went to the pool area to sit outside and work on my laptop in the sun. Ahhhh..... just lovely! And, the beds are super comfortable too! I would highly recommend this property to anyone who needs to stay in LA but doesn't want to deal with a huge mega-property. It is so easy to get in/out of and I love that the whole building is wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste money on Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Persika
Reviews.Content: The Orlando turned out to be a great disappointment. The hotel does not have a sign, so it took several rounds of going around the block before finding it. The staff is extremely fake when pretending to be friendly and helpful. I had to give repeated instructions to the valet guy and the bellman about their own jobs. I would say the rooms are at most 2.5stars. The TV and the alarm clock did not work and when I called the staff about it expecting someone to come up and repair it, all I got was an insincere "We're sorry, we don't have anyone available to fix them." I was shocked at the level of indifference and lack of professionalism. The breakfast was at best mediocre. We were told not so sit outside because it was going to be cleaned, which turned out to be a lie to cut down work for the staff. The only good feature of this hotel is its location. But there are several other hotels in the area with far better service. At first I thought this was general LA culture but after transferring to a different hotel, I realized that the horrible service was unique to the Orlando. Do not waste your money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, AWESOME location !!”
Reviews.Author: six7777
Reviews.Content: Really a great place to stay. I wouldn't call it a five star hotel, it has been updated, but they cut corners in some ways. Nothing major, they just could of done a better job, it looks like they used staff or a handyman to do lights, faucets, etc. Besides that, the place is great. Friendly staff, nice rooms, super beds. I have stayed there 2 times in total. I will continue to stay there. The price is right, the valet parking is nice, and the location is the BEST. You can walk to the Grove from there, and a ton of other stuff. Alot of cool stores, and great restaurants within walking distance. Very cool.

Reviews.Title: “soft towels and delicious chocolates”
Reviews.Author: daveb50
Reviews.Content: The title points out my favorite things about the Orlando but I enjoyed the entire experience. It is definitely a place for those looking for a small, homey experience. The staff was friendly and helpful and everything was extremely clean. There have been some comments about the dated bathrooms but ours seemed to be newly renovated so I would suggest asking for a room with a new bath. I would call the room decor "Crate and Barrel", more contemporary than traditional. Loved the neighborhood! It was within walking distance of the Farmer's Market and the streets were filled with boutiques and many small, reasonably priced restaurants. I was pleasantly surprised that it had a (small) pool and fitness center, a free computer for use in the lobby and wireless access in the lounge. All in all, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but "interesting first experience”
Reviews.Author: windycitygal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orlando this past weekend and echo most of the reviews that have been written -- great location, nice rooms (except bathrooms which need to be updated further) and good service. However... I was booked at the hotel last month and arrived late morning to drop off my bag then go about my day of business. When I arrived just after 9 following a business dinner and long day, I was told that because a couple of people didn't check out of the hotel, they didn't have a room for me. I was told that I had been booked in a Ramada 10 minutes away on Santa Monica Blvd. Hmmm. A Ramada on Santa Monica Blvd? This could be bad. Really bad. Turns out the room was fine and the hotel was on a decent part of SMB. Plus, The Orlando paid for the cab ride to the Ramada and paid for my room there. I've never had something like that happen to me in my career. However, it was disturbing that a man was checking into the hotel as they were wisking me out the door and into a cab. Why a room for him and not me when I was there first? Everyone deserves a second chance so I stayed there this weekend. Best part of the hotel is definitely the great proximity to shopping, both along Third Street and on Robertson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: VIcLovesHolidays
Reviews.Content: I reported before that the vallet parking was $12 per night - just checked my records and its actually $26 per night! But other wise the hotel is great, a fantastic location and good value so don't let this put you off!

Reviews.Title: “European Style in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: PortabelloRoadChick
Reviews.Content: So it was our son's 30th birthday last week and we were surprising him with a sumptuous surprise party. Therefore, we needed a place to stay out of his view. After much careful research only a marketing maven such as myself undergoes, I opted for the self-described small European style boutique Orlando Hotel. What a delightful gem in the middle of Beverly Hills! Arriving late into the evening, we drove up in our rental car to be greeted without any wait by friendly attendants. Upon entering, the lobby was awash in candlelight, as votives were lit on nearby tables. Check in was a breeze and before we knew it we were looking out over the surrounding area twinkling as only L.A. does. Service here, while California laid back, was excellent. We called down for extra sugar and creamer and it seemed he was waiting outside our door - it was so quick. In fact, our every request was met with courtesy and superb promptness. The room reminded me of the Swissotel in London. It was clean, modern, and with all the creature comforts including robes (heavy), slippers, in room coffee, hair dryers, and a very nice bathroom vanity which was supplied with Bulgari toiletries. The bed was plushly adorned and very comfortable and room service did a great job. In room TV is a wall mounted very large screen and local and national newspapers are available every morning. This place is intimate, modern, clean and delightful and worth every reasonable penny. Now for the best part - we booked our room at $299 a night for a king sized bed, which also included breakfast in thehotel restaurant downstairs. It's small and delicious with fresh fruits, eggs done-any- style and more. Parking was $26. Now even better - this was all in the heart of downtown Beverly Hills...so close you can walk to everything or take a very short drive to Melrose for even more fantabulous shopping which a good New York girl like me did! I highly recommend this jewel. At this price, with breakfast and reasonable parking rates, you are treated like a celebrity without the celebrity prices. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss the Orlando”
Reviews.Author: gaudifan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days at the Orlando with my teenage son and husband. This is a great hotel and a fabulous location. The room is large and very comfortable, the staff very helpful. (The valet managed to have our car ready for us in minutes each time we needed it.) The location is central for getting around LA, but the real highlight is that there are many fine restauarants and stores within walking distance. Our first day we dined at a Japanese place about 4 doors away that turned out to be one of the best meals of the trip. The nearby stores were some of the most interesting I've seen anywhere. I have stayed in Century City, Beverly Hills and Santa Monica in the past, but will return to the Orlando for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at The Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCarol999
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days there on business and was thrilled with my stay at The Orlando. I prefer smaller boutique hotels. The room was large, the bed comfortable and came with a complimentary full breakfast. Great and fast service in the restaurant, at the front desk and also the valet. The location was perfect -- lots in the neighbourhood within walking distance including excellent restaurants and shopping. The farmers market in The Grove was a nice find. The location was also central to my business calls within the entertainment business. I will absolutely stay there the next time I'm in LA and will recommend it wholeheartedly to my colleagues and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel713
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel so much and will definately return! The bed was so comfortable. The rooms were clean and the service was fantastic. The concierge was extremely helpful. We requested to dine at various hot restaurants and he took care of it all. The area of this hotel was great. I am so happy i chose this hotel for my first visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Coughton54
Reviews.Content: Nice, small boutique style hotel with a great location for Beverly Hills and City. Only 9 miles from LAX. Clean rooms and very helpful responsive staff. Restaurant was very good and excellent selection of other restaurants with easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Snazzy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NJNora
Reviews.Content: The Orlando has real style mixed with real comfort. The rooms are large and bright with windows that open. We have stayed in 2 rooms there and both had nice seating areas and great beds. On the 3rd Street side you can see the Hollywood sign but pay for that with a bit of noise. Bathrooms are motel quality except they have very nice products. It is located in a great area with lots of restaurants and shopping. Staff were very nice and helpful. As only in LA, we saw Peter Bogdanovich catch an elevator in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LAVisitors
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at The Orlando five times in the past two years as we go to Los Angeles often to visit our children. We plan several trips this coming year. We love this hotel and really look forward to our stays there! The rooms are very roomy and comfortable and quiet-- beds are greatt!! In fact, after our last visit we returned home and bought a new mattress because theirs was so comforable. We asked what it was and looked for the same brand. The staff is outstanding!! Always friendly and ready to answer questions and help. And they always seem to remember us and welcome us with a smile. The location is terrific. Close to the Beverly Center and the Grove but on a quiet side street off Third Street. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. And great shopping too. We love the European buffet breakfast which is a real treat and very unusual, and, again, the staff here is friendly and we enjoy "visiting " with them. We have never used the pool but it is a nice extra. It's a quiet little oasis in the city. I travel often and wish other hotels would feel as comfortable and welcoming as The Orlando. We look forward to our visits there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely adore this Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaulBH
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write about the experience we had at the Orlando Hotel for our family and friends that we put up there for New Year's Eve. We have used this hotel always for friends and referred business associates as well. I absolutely adore this hotel. The rooms are spacious and charming, the staff is top notch and always delivers exceptional service with a smile. I know hotel prices in LA are climbing as they did in New York. A lot of people do not like that and dish the hotel in defiance. You get what you pay for and it's worth every penny at The Orlando and compared to other hotels in the area that offer less for more $$$ it's the best value. I know, because I shop around!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressive, You Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: CinJo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orlando after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. It was a disappointment. The room had a musty smell and the bed was as hard as a rock w/ flat pillows. The toilet was hard to flush, the faucets didn't turn off and the bathroom was in need of renovation. We were promised turn-down service with chocolates and noone ever showed up.

Reviews.Title: “Unbalanced”
Reviews.Author: lusciouskiwi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice. The first time was ok. This time our room was not as good as the first one. The view was terrible, the traffic noise was very loud and the bathroom was in a state of disrepair. We returned to this hotel because of the comfortable bed. This was perhaps the most disappointing part of our stay. The bed felt very different, we weren't sure what the problem was. It was like the first one had a soft mattress topper that was missing. I woke up sore each day. I have to mention the complimentary ice machine. There was only one and it was located in a little room on the second floor along with old, dusty items the hotel wasn't using anymore (fake plants etc.) The hotel also ran out of decaf coffee for two days. That's all I drink, so it really tainted things for me. We had a friend in another room - a handicap room. He slept on a Murphy bed! There was a problem with the plumbing in the bathroom. He said the room was a really odd shape. If you were in a wheelchair or mobility impaired you would be trapped. You had to get out of bed to see the alarm clock. I am sorry Orlando, but I cannot give your hotel a good review. It is very inconsistent. If you are truly used to luxury properties or boutique hotels, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and under renovated”
Reviews.Author: Jack9003
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at The Orlando last minute and was quoted an outrageous price of $319. I was told I would be staying in a gorgeous king room with a garden patio so I thought it was worth the splurge and I was running out of options. The hotel has been recently renovated and you can still see signs of the motel it was in the corridors and bathrooms. The room is just barely "boutique" and claims that label merely by virtue of an overstuffed bed, a flat screen TV and an iPod holder. The patio was tiny and looked out onto a busy street, the bathroom was unclean and still showed signs of wear and tear, the carpet was stained. We got breakfast with our room and that was quite nice and that is why I give the hotel even one star. With taxes and valet parking (compulsory) the bill came to $400. For that I should have been in Venice or Beverly Hills not hanging over 3rd street looking at a dirty patio! Don't stay here, LA has many other options.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough.”
Reviews.Author: RoadTrip19Mom
Reviews.Content: -Nice, large room. They charge $15/day for rollaway, but we brought our own camping cot and there was plenty of room. -Most of the staff on the phone and front desk was excellent. -There was a recent policy change (if you get a discounted rate, you don't get executive floor privileges) but since we hadn't been told that, they reinstated those after my later call to ask about it. -Nice pool. --One of the "exec". perks: $10 cab voucher for every full day you stay. So over the course of two nights, we got one, and it came in handy. --Breakfast at on-site cafe was very well serviced, but not very imaginative for the pricing and swank ambience. Really, you just get at the bar fruit, yogurt, one each of cheese and sliced deli meat, and by waiter, eggs, limited omelets, or fritattas, plain panckakes and bacon (no sausage.) That's it. **If you don't get exec. perks, and note: you only get two coupons per room per night, you and your family and/or discerning palate might be better off getting your discounted rate and walking up the street 1-4 blocks for breakfast for same or less cost. Breakfast is $20/adult and $12 a kid at the on-site cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Vanilla hotel only lip syncing "Boutique"”
Reviews.Author: lannyweb
Reviews.Content: A convenient location for Beverly Hills and the Miracle Mile, but nothing fancy here, except the room rates and the handsome Web site. Coat of brown paint, minimalist lobby and dimly lit halls dress up what is basically a plain vanilla, 1970s-era hotel building. An adequate stay, I guess, but the Orlando's true age and frail bones peek through tired bathroom fixtures, low ceilings and thin walls. Included breakfast holds limited buffet selection or choice of scrambled-but-not-fried eggs and a single pancake (or was it a hot-mitt?) with syrup from a plastic package. (Four stars to the fried chicken and cobbler at Cynthia's restaurant one block up 3rd.)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but that's it”
Reviews.Author: nola75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orlando for one night as this was a last minute trip and most of the other hotels in the area (Beverly Hills) were booked. The problems started from the moment I went to my room. Housekeeping was still cleaning the room at 4pm. Was given another room, an Executive King. The room was big and had a seating area. The bathroom was a completely different story. You could barely close the door, it was sooo tiny. The fixtures and plumbing are extremely outdated; alot of rust. The air conditioning took about 6 hours to actually start cooling down the room. Walls are paper thin, I could hear a baby crying and a dog barking from the rooms next door. The positive was the location. Its on 3rd, walking distance to the Beverly Center and the Grove.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Arkmont
Reviews.Content: The reception area and lounge are extremely pleasant and inviting, but once you arrive on the guest room floors it begins to fall apart. I paid extra for a "garden room" which meant I had french doors onto an airshaft with 10 foot walls on all sides; even worse, the guests at the pool could look down into the air shaft and my room...so absolutely no privacy. The room itself was a nice size but the furnishings are worn. There was little steet noise in my room but there was substantial noise from rooms on either side and upstairs. Internet connection didn't work and room was not cleaned until after 3:00 thoughout trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service-Noisy-Dirty”
Reviews.Author: VictorNewYork
Reviews.Content: You hear from your room every noise that any of the other rooms on the sides does (speak, shower, any little noise they do) + everything that happen in the street and in the corridors of the floor. The bathroom tube supposed to be white but is grey because of poor cleaning. The hotel personnel did not care about clients inconvenients. It is more a 2 star hotel... only a very cosy lobby/recepcion but unfortunately you d'ont sleep in the looby. I swicht my Stay to Le Meridien... That is a real incredible hotel with great accomodation and incredible service AT THE SAME PRICE !! Definitely a place to avoid !

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fan2006
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Elan, but they overbooked & set us up at the Orlando. It worked out for the best, since the Orlando was a better location for us. 3rd street is full of small boutiques. There are shopping malls on either end of 3rd. (The Grove & the Beverly Center). The Orlando (once known as the Beverly Plaza) has recently undergone an extensive renovation. The staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: dunnjun
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Orlando for a business trip and enjoyed my experience there. Me and my associates were there for 4 nights and would stay there again. For us, the main thing we liked best was the location. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood where we felt safe to walk around during our free time. There are plenty of restuarants and shops right across the street. I wish we had more free time to explore the area. The hotel has a nice interior and is really relaxed. The breakfast that came complimentary was excellent. The rooms were a nice size and I really enjoyed the flat screen tv that you could swivel around. The only down side was the bathroom. I didn't think it was as run-down as previous reviews said. There was some wear and tear to it, but it was clean to my satisfaction and I'm pretty picky about that. But my shower was not the best, it kind of just spat the water out. One of the people travelling with me is over 6' tall and felt like the bathroom was not comfortable for someone his size. I'm 5'2" and thought that the sink was even low for me. Overall, I would stay there again for business, but I don't know if I would stay there on my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Average for Price”
Reviews.Author: blevinm
Reviews.Content: We selected the Orlando for its boutique style as advertised and found it to be just average. It certainly does not compare with Kimpton hotels or others I would consider in the same class. The included breakfast was excellent and a nice way to start the day. Although be sure to ask for both the omelette & pancakes (very good!) with your breakfast if you're so inclined- we got the impression that we had to choose one, but in fact both are included. The staff were friendly and helpful and the lobby and TV Room nearby are relaxing touches if you've been out on the town for a while. The rooms have a modern feel and are nicely decorated, however you can sense that underneath the exterior is an outdated, dusty older hotel room. The bathrooms are the most outdated with cheap lavatories and bad tub / shower fixtures. Throughout there is also a lot of dust accumulated around vents and in corners. A spider greeted us as we entered our room, although we had no further bug issues. We had a pool view that was nice, but much of the surrounding buildings look run down and dirty. The location is the highlight of the hotel. You can walk to the Beverly Center shopping mall, the 3rd & Fairfax farmer's market, or the shops and restaurants on Robertson in about 15 minutes. If you are using Taxi's the hotel will give you a voucher book worth $10, but we found the cab drivers reluctant to accept the vouchers. We also found nearly all taxi's to be in poor condition, bad drivers with no manners, and generally undesirable to travel in. Overall, the hotel delivers an okay experience for a very high price. I would probably recommend staying at a larger chain hotel if I were to return- somewhere where I know what I will get for the money. Until this hotel upgrades further, I just wouldn't pay the price for the experience. Like much of L.A. this one is dressed up nicely but lacking substance.

Reviews.Title: “Best no-car place in LA!!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaK
Reviews.Content: by: a woman traveller from Manhattan This is my new favorite place in LA. It's a newly-refurbished boutique hotel with about 100 rooms and a very pleasant European-feeling lobby, decorated with candles and blown glass objects, and it's in the best possible location for a traveler without a car - it's as easy to walk to dozens or hundreds of restaurants and shops as it would be in downtown Manhattan. Furthermore, the shops themselves are exceptional, as 3rd Street is a prime area for fresh boutiques and top-notch LA vintage shopping. My room was pleasant and large, with a king-size bed and a seting area with a sofa. Temperature control was excellent, service was pleasant, a view of the Hollywood Hills was agreeable, and a leaky faucet handle was repaired the instant I reported it. The restaurant food is excellent. The cost of my room included breakfast, which was generous - a nice buffet and eggs or pancakes if you felt like ordering them; one day there were elegant French apple tarts, every day there was homemade (I think) banana and zucchini bread. (If I'd wanted to, I could have booked a room for $20 less without the breakfast and found a dozen places to eat for less outside the hotel, but I liked the convenience this time.) From the money angle, it's worth noting that on nearby La Cienega it's easy to find nice simple chain places like Chipotle for a really fast, really cheap meal. A small pool is set nicely with comfortable lounge chairs for sunbathing. A small exercise room adjacent to the pool has the essentials and I did not ever have to wait to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: alicegbaker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel because I do business with Cedars Sinai (which is within walking distance). If you like a more european experince as opposed to a typical US business experience (like staying at the Marriott), this hotel may be for you. Quite chic in it's decor, the restaurant is good (if a little expensive), and the rooms are nice (not great). I do always have a little trouble getting online at this hotel. Great shopping and restaurants are also within walking distance. Stay on the 5th floor if you want a little more service.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, with positives and negatives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very pricey area, but we still expected more for the $344 for two nights we paid. The positives were the location near many museums and sights, the fitness room and small mineral pool, the linens and down duvets, the serene and modern decor, and the friendly front desk and valet. The breakfast that was included was served in the adjoining restaurant,"La Terza" and it was a nice buffet of fruits, yogurt, granola and ham and cheese. The negatives were that the hot water in the shower was just lukewarm, the room was not immaculate (There was dust clogged in the vents and some cobwebs in upper corners.) The walls are very thin, so we could easily hear voices and TV from the next room and slamming doors.. Although the front desk was friendly, several of them were not very knowledgable of directions and nearby sights.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: asdbarnes
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 2:45 pm to check in and had to wait about 10 minutes for my room. OK, 10 minutes, no big deal. The lobby was nice enough, the "lounge" was relaxing and the front desk staff was friendly. I got my room key, dropped my bags and left to go shopping. I came back around 7 pm that night only to find that I had no hot water, among other probelems. For a "luxury boutique" hotel, I was truly disappointed. The rooms had been redone, but they forgot the bathrooms. The fixtures are outdated (think 1970s), there were burn marks on the orange countertop, and there was a significant black and rust stain in the tub. Not to mention, there was hardly any water pressure. The rickety cheap metal closet doors don't open and close properly if the safe door is open. The walls were so thin, I could hear the phone ring and the subsequent conversation in the room next door. I could also hear the people above me walking around all night. I called the front desk who immediately sent people up to try to fix the problems. Housekeeping told me there was nothing they could do about the stain. The safety lock was also loose. The maintenance man told me I would have to wait at least a night or two before he could fix, and as the housekeeper left, the entire thing came off in my hands. She just looked at me and shrugged. The "pool" is a joke. I've seen tubs bigger than that. The restaurant is OK. The free breakfast is basically fruit and yogurt. If you want eggs, bacon or toast, you have to order it. All in all, I will NEVER go back or recommend this place to anyone. If you want something in the area, try The Parc Suites. It's MUCH better.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At check in time, I found the desk clerk to be arrogant and rude. The only reason I didn't walk out right then and there was the intervention of another staff member who walked in when he heard what was going on. When I went up to the room, it was not made up (this was at 3:00 PM). The air conditioning was extremely noisy and the fan function (low, med, high) didn't work - it seemed to be stuck on high. It is also not clear that the temperature setting was functional - I varied it from 68 to 74 and could detect no difference in either temperature or on/off cycling of the unit. Overnight parking (valet only) was over $20.00! The restaurant was extremely expensive, pretentious, and, while the wait staff provided good service, the food was mediocre at best - an $18 breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs (dry and cold), one (burnt) slice of bacon, and a cold piece of toast that seemed to have been warmed in a microwave. I would not recommend this hotel under any circumstances and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Orlando is a real find”
Reviews.Author: Robin69
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Orlando and couldn't have been happier. I arrived early for check in and they were able to accommodate me. From the moment I pulled in to the valet parking area, I felt welcomed. After arriving in my room, the front desk attendant called to make sure everything was alright. The bedding is wonderful and the beds comfortable. The parking is outrageous ($20 per car), but includes in and out privileges. The restaurant was great - a nice open space. The complimentary breakfast was also top notch - not some day-old rolls, but granola, milk, yogurt, fruit and meat and cheese. Also, was able to order eggs and/or pancakes. Wasn't able to check out the pool - it was closed. Also, I think there was some remodeling going on in the room next door, so you might want to ask about that when you make your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, good shopping”
Reviews.Author: Beans and Cornbread
Reviews.Content: The Orlando's staff is attentive and helpful but as others have mentioned, the rooms are a bit junky for the price, especially the bathrooms. If you are there for shopping, there's plenty of good places around there -- Plastica, Built By Wendy, Paul Frank et al but other than that, the neighborhood is rather boring.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby area is lovely. But, the individual rooms are worn, tired and quite unkempt looking. The rugs and chairs were very stained and dirty. We didn't even want to sit in the chairs. The bathrooms are very much in need of repair and updating. Service was less than responsive. We waited at the pool almost one hour and several calls later for towels. Several of the front desk/guest relations gentlemen seemed rude and condescending. However, the staff in the restaurant were very nice and willing to please. Other than the gracious staff in the restaurant and good hotel location, there is nothing else to compliment. I would not recommend this facility, even with its competitive price. It is worth spending a few more dollars to stay somewhere clean and where staff are responsive and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: newtonSA
Reviews.Content: The Orlando was a wonderful place to stay during our brief visit to LA. My husband and I along with many other Texas Longhorn fans,spend several nights at this boutique hotel. Great location, great breakfast, courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased”
Reviews.Author: teedeeandchelchel
Reviews.Content: I really stuggled with choosing a hotel for our most recent Los Angeles 4 day trip, but was very pleased with our choice of The Orlando. I discovered a special on their website which rewarded us with and Ipod nano with a 3 night stay in one of their Executive Floor rooms. These rooms have been recently renovated and were very up to date and pleasant. The bathrooms are small, but fine. Our stay also included full breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, La Terza, which was excellent. We had dinner there one night as well and the meal was very good. I was most pleased with the hotel's location on 3rd St. which has many "hip" shops and wonderful restaurants. It is also an easy walk to the Beverly Center for those who need a mega-mall and a bit longer walk to the famous Farmers Market which is also a great spot for a variety of great cuisines. Probably the biggest downfall is the traffic noise from 3rd St, but I must say, I am a light sleeper, but slept just fine. The staff is very accomodating with helping with tour and restaurant reservations as well as directions and advice on good restaurant choices.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location. Friendly and attentive staff. Nice restaurant with a good breakfast as part of our rate. Tired and rather dirty rooms - stains on carpets, furniture, etc. No fitted sheets on the mattresses - just top sheets tucked under which tended to come out during the night. Our room was unavailable on the first night so we were sent to another property. The first night was comped although we are still waiting for the charge reversal on the credit card - 10 days later.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of temperamental valet!”
Reviews.Author: eblkcat
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel has undergone some "cosmetic changes" in the restaurant and lobby, no improvements were done to the rooms, and they are starting to look tired! The hotel staff itself was nice; but one of the valet parkers was so rude and argumentative after we found a 4 inch scratch on our car - this occured while we were checking in and he had the keys to the car the whole time! He claims the scratch was old, however, once you ran your hand over it, paint fell off! Location wise, the hotel is perfect, no matter what direction you are going in, and very safe! But- ask for a room on the top floor - or you will be awake off and on all night by random noises coming off the street!!
